Fermina C. is from the village of Bolinao. She is 42 years old. Fermina is widowed and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Fermina owns & operates a general store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Fermina has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Fermina joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Fermina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Fermina is requesting a new loan of 9000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand product offering. This will be the 3rd loan taken out by Fermina from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay her children's tuition fees. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand product offering

loans.name: Essi

texts.en: Madame Essi K. is 41 years old and lives in her birthplace, Lome, Togo. She sells 'argile', a kind of clay used for construction. Madame K. purchases her merchandise across the border in Ghana to sell near her home in Lome. She has requested a loan of 500,000 CFA in order to purchase 50 more sacks of the clay. She is the mother and sole caregiver of two children. This loan will hopefully provide her with a more stable and increased income in order to provide for the needs of her family.

loans.use: To purchase 50 sacks of construction clay

loans.name: Daniel

texts.es: El señor Daniel es un hombre muy trabajador, el tiene un taller de soldadura y le hecha muchas ganas para darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida, el requiere de este crédito para construir una barda a un lado de su vivienda, por la seguridad de su familia.  La señora María Antonia se dedica al hogar y al cuidado del único hijo que vive con ellos, ya que todos ya están grandes y están casados.
texts.en:
Daniel is a hardworking man. He has a welding shop and has been lucky enough to give his family a better quality of life. He needs this loan to build a protective wall around one side of his house, which will make his family safer. María Antonia is a homemaker. She takes care of the only child who lives with them; the others have already grown up and gotten married.

Translated from Spanish by Ross Forman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To build a protective wall

loans.name: Mila

texts.en:
Mila Y. is from the village of Bolinao. She is 53 years old. Mila is married and has 5 adult children. To make a living, Mila owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from planting & harvesting  a variety of vegetables for sale. Mila has been engaged in her business for over 26 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2006, Mila joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Mila has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. Mila is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP which will be used to pay for services to increase crop yield. This will be the 8th loan taken out by Mila from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to pay for services to increase crop yield

loans.name: Vedaste

texts.en:
Vedaste is 36 years old and is married with one child who is two years old.  His wife is a businesswoman and together they are able to have health insurance for the family.  

Vedaste owns a motorcycle.  He buys goods locally and transports them to other areas to sell.  He has been doing this business for 3 years.  He also has a small shop that serves small food items and drinks. With a loan, he plans to increase the amount of food and drink he buys for his shop in order to increase his sales.  Eventually he wants to become an investor in other local businesses.

loans.use: Buying more inventory of food items and drinks

loans.name: Unidas En El Trabajo Group

texts.es:
Cuando Aurora de los Santos ayudaba a su amiga en  su negocio de comida no pensó que algún día ella tendría el suyo propio y así fue, su amiga viajo y se lo encargo  pero ya no volvió es así que ella se hizo cargo del negocio  son  12 personas que trabajan en una fabrica  a quienes les vende el  almuerzo también tiene su negocio de venta de desayuno   dentro de un mercado  le va muy bien por que los trabajadores del mercado son sus mayores clientes  gracias a su trabajo  ha podido comprarle a su hijo una computadora  y pagarle los estudios a su hijo en un instituto particular. 

En lo que se refiere a su negocio  para el futuro esta pensando  alquilar un puesto de venta mas grande y poner una jugueria  ahora empezará  otro negocio de venta de menudencias de pollo ya tiene una congeladora que compro con sus ahorros y con su préstamo  actual comprara las menudencias para empezar a vender, el grupo al cual pertenece se llama “ UNIDAS TRIUNFAREMOS” son 10 socias y ella es la presidenta por primera vez espera desempeñar una buena función.

*Aurora de los Santos es la cuarta de la derecha
texts.en:
When Aurora de los Santos was helping a friend in her food business she never thought that one day she would have her own. But that´s how it was, her friend traveled and left her in charge, but she never returned and so Aurora took over. They sell lunch to 12 people who work in a factory and they also have a business in the market selling breakfast. It is going quite well because the workers at the market are their best customers. Thanks to this, she has been able to buy her son a computer and to pay for his studies at a private school. As for her business, in the future she is planning to rent out a bigger space and install a juice bar. For now she is starting another business selling chicken giblets and she already has a freezer that she bought with her savings. With this loan she will buy the giblets so she can start selling. The group that she belongs to is called "UNIDAS TRIUNFAERMOS", there are 10 members and for the first time she is the president and hopes to do a good job. * Aurora de los Santos is the fourth from the right.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy supplies for their businesses.

loans.name: Rosejen

texts.en:
Rosejen D. is from the village of Manano. She is 47 years old. Rosejen is married and has 3 children. To make a living, Rosejen owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from raising pigs for breeding. Rosejen has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Rosejen joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rosejen has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in future. Rosejen is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed & other supplies. This will be the 2nd loan taken out by Rosejen from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay her children's tuition fees. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed & other supplies

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en:
Violeta R. is from the village of Sto. Niño. She is 40 years old. Violeta is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Violeta owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from planting & harvesting  a variety of vegetables for sale. Violeta has been engaged in her business for over 21 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2006, Violeta joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Violeta has successfully repaid a previous loan of 22,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to repair a transport vehicle used in the business. Violeta is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This will be the 10th loan taken out by Violeta from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to make improvements to her house. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Bryan

texts.en:
Bryan S. is from the village of Brgy. Tucal, Solano, Nueva Vizcaya. He is 25 years old. Bryan is married and has 2 very young children. To make a living, Bryan owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from raising pigs to breed. Bryan has been engaged in his business for over 4 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Bryan joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Bryan is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed & other supplies. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Bryan from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of his family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed & other supplies

loans.name: Jose Luis

texts.es: El señor José Luis, es un hombre muy trabajador, el trabaja en una empresa donde hacen tarimas de madera, el vive solo, ya que es soltero. El señor José hace poco tiempo pidió una casa de interes social, pero el quiere acondicionarla, para estar mas cómodo en ella.  Necesita construir una barda por motivos de seguridad para la casa, ya que el señor José Luis sale muy seguido de la cuidad ya que si trabajo así lo requiere, y la casa se queda sola en su ausencia, ya han entrado a robarle y no quiere que vuelva a suceder.
texts.en:
José Luis is a hardworking man. He works for a company that makes wooden flooring. He lives alone and is single. José recently got a house from social welfare, but he wants to renovate it so he can live in it comfortably. He needs to build a protective wall to make it safer. He is often away in the city or at work, meaning that the house is unoccupied for long periods. He is afraid that he will be robbed and does not want this to happen.

Translated from Spanish by Ross Forman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Construction of a protective wall

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene L. is from the village of Burgos. She is 33 years old. Irene is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Irene owns & operates a general store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Irene is just starting this business.

In 2010, Irene joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Irene has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Irene is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 2nd loan taken out by Irene from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Daria

texts.en:
Daria B. is from the village of San Jose, Enrile, Cagayan. She is 54 years old. Daria is married and has 7 adult children. To make a living, Daria owns & operates a business venture providing recycling services. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from hauling junk & other waste material for local businesses and community members. Daria has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 7000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Daria joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Daria has successfully repaid a previous loan of 17,000 PHP from ASKI. Daria is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional plastics & other recyclables to sell. This will be the 5th loan taken out by Daria from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional plastics & other recyclables to sell

loans.name: Irene's Group

texts.en:
Irene B. is from the village of Burgos. She is 30 years old. Irene is the group leader of a 5-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is 'Irene B.'.

Irene is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Irene owns & operates a general store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Irene has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 6000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Irene joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Irene is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Irene from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Ma. Del Rosario

texts.es: La señora Ma. Del Rosario, trabaja en una empresa ayudando en la limpieza, es una persona muy trabajadora, también vende ropa usada los fines de semana, la señora Ma. Del Rosario se divorcio hace tiempo, y ahora vive sola en su vivienda, ella quiere poner una tienda de abarrotes, pero el dinero que tiene ahorrado no le alcanza para surtir la tienda, es por eso que pide este crédito, para comprar todo lo necesario para la tienda, y así poder dejar el trabajo de limpieza y dedicarse solo a estar en su casa atendiendo la tienda de abarrotes.
texts.en:
Ma. Del Rosario, works in a private business where she helps with the cleaning. She is a hardworking person, and also sells used clothing on the weekends. Ma. Del Rosario has been divorced for some time and now lives alone. She wants to set up a small grocery store in her house, but hasn't saved enough to be able to fully stock the store. That's why she is requesting this loan, to buy everything necessary. She will then be able to leave her custodial job and dedicate herself completely to the grocery store.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business investment.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica B. is from the village of Bolinao. She is 29 years old. Veronica is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Veronica owns & operates a general store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Veronica has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Veronica joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Veronica is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand product offering. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Veronica from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand product offering

loans.name: Manolito

texts.en:
Manolito F. is from the village of Brgy. Tucal, Solano, Nueva Vizcaya. He is 58 years old. Manolito is married and has 5 adult children. To make a living, Manolito manufactures and sells charcoal. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from manufacturing, buying and selling charcoal to local businesses and community members. Manolito has been engaged in his business for over 8 years and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Manolito joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Manolito is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw materials to manufacture additional products. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Manolito from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of his family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials to manufacture additional charcoal

loans.name: Precious Women Group

texts.en:
Oldlady Y. who is holding the sign, is the leader of a group of five borrowers called 'Precious Women'. She is 38 years old, married, and has four children who range from 4 to 15 years old. She was not able to attend school due to poverty. All of her children are attending school. 

For 8 years, she has been selling red oil, 'fufu' ( a local food produced from cassava) and fish in Marshall City, Margibi County, Liberia.

She plans to use her 12,000 Liberian Dollar portion of this 60,000 Liberian Dollar group loan to buy more gallons of red oil, more 'fufu' and fish. She describes herself as a hard-working woman.

Her goal is to improve her business, build a house, and educate her children so that they can have a better future.

loans.use: To buy more gallons of red oil, more 'fufu' and fish

loans.name: Amor Y Amistad 3 & 4 Group

texts.en:
Tania is the coordinator of her group Amor y Amistad 3 & 4 (Love and Peace). She makes her home here in a simple structure with her husband and 3 children. She says that her most difficult challenge is to have a better life.  In the meantime she plans to continue enjoying eating ice cream, and in the future she would like to run her own ice cream store.

Tania is excited to be taking her 11th loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loans and grown her business. She has had her business for 5 years, starting with buying beauty products, selling them and doing beauty services when visiting her clients' homes. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business by buying a seat to use while brushing her clients' hair, chairs and some beauty products. She will also add a telephone service. She will use the profits to buy some items her family needs, like clothes and school supplies, and also plans to save. She wants to have her own home, move her business to another location in a busier street, such as a shopping district, and would like to buy a car. 

This Esperanza associate began with us because she is interested and motivated to work in business. Her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti) clients generally. Her group is located in Samana, a lush rugged peninsula with a nascent tourism industry. This area, like nearly all impoverished areas of the Dominican Republic, suffers from unreliable running water (none of which is potable) and electricity.

loans.use: Cosmetics and beauty products

loans.name: God’S Children Group

texts.en:
Musu S., who is holding the sign, is the leader of this group of five borrowers called God’s Children. Musu is 56 years old, married, and has six children who range from 21 to 35 years old. She was not able to attend school due to lack of financial support. She cares for one sibling.

For 6 years, she has been selling charcoal in Gbengba Town Market on the outskirts of Monrovia, Liberia. She plans to use her 8,000 Liberian Dollar portion of this 40,000 Liberian Dollar group loan to buy more bags of charcoal.

She describes herself as a hard-working woman. Her dream is to grow her business and build a house.

In the photo that accompanies this profile, Andrew is inset at lower right because he was absent during disbursal.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal

loans.name: Othon

texts.es:
Othon de 65 años, el tiene una tienda de víveres para solventar lo gastos familiares, vive en una casa de cemento y tablas, ubicada en el Fortín de Guayaquil. 

El comenzó a comprar víveres para solventar los gastos desde hace 15 años atrás por la falta de oportunidades, compro bebidas, granos, aceites etc. Ahora desde ese tiempo hasta ahora trabaja desde las 05h30am todos los días.   

Para poder incrementar su negocio el quiere comprar mas víveres como aceites, arroz y vitrinas. En el futuro quiere agrandar mas la tienda para tener mas estabilidad económica y terminar de construir su casa.
texts.en:
Othon, age 65, owns a general store. The income from his business covers his family's living expenses. He lives in a cement and tile house located on Fortín de Guayaquil. Othon began his store when he was 15 years old, because there were no other work opportunities. He sold beverages, cereals, oil, etc. Ever since, Othon has gone to work everyday, starting at 5:30 a.m. To increase his sales, he wants to buy more provisions such as oil, rice, and display cabinets. In the future he wants to expand the store so that he has greater financial security and can finish building his house.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of display cases

loans.name: Carmen Tulia

texts.es: Carmen T. es una joven diseñadora de bermudas y chaquetas deportivas en materiales de telas y sus derivados del cuero, tiene un hijo de 5 años y con su esposo trabajan para sacarlo adelante,  en su experiencia familiar de talleres de confección a Carmen se le ocurrió desde hace un año, cuando observando que en los sistemas de promoción del comercio Bogotano mas conocido en esta ciudad como “El madrugon”, les fue muy bien y ella decidió comprar una pantaloneta para plasmar su primer diseño como muestra y de allí sacar los moldes requeridos para la venta, que inició entre sus amigos y gradualmente ha ido extendiéndola a centros comerciales almacenes del centro de Bogotá entre otros espacios de mercado, donde han tenido teniendo una gran aceptación.  Carmen aunque tiene su propio taller su meta es aumentar el número de clientes y su gran desafío es encontrar los talleres satélites idóneos para tal fin y en un futuro comprar su casa propia, por eso con su   credikiva, que es su primer crédito con la Fundación Mario Sano Domingo, ella comprará los insumos como telas, cauchos y acabados para fabricar sus productos y para seguir haciendo crecer su negocio día a día.
texts.en:
Carmen T. is a young designer; she creates athletic shorts and jackets from fabric and leather. She has a 5-year old son and together with her husband, works hard to get ahead. Carmen has some experience tailoring, and it occurred to her last year that the vendors in the biggest commercial centers in Bogotá, such as El Madrugon, did very well in business. She bought some sweatpants to try out her first design, and thereafter bought patterns with a group of friends. From there she has gradually expanded to other commercial centers and department stores in Bogotá, where she has been very successful. Although Carmen already has her own tailoring workshop her goal is to increase the number of clients she has. Her challenges include setting up additional tailoring workshops and in the future, saving enough to buy her own house. With her Kiva loan, her first with Fundación Mario Sano Domingo, Carmen will buy supplies such as fabrics, elastic, and adornments to make clothing and continue building her business day by day.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fabric, elastic, and adornments to make clothing

loans.name: Cesar

texts.es:
El señor Cesar L. esta muy agradecida por su cooperación en el anterior crédito el cual pudo poner la instalaciones de la luz en toda la casa.
Esta nuevamente solicitando un préstamo para poder termina los acabados del interior y exterior de la vivienda ya que actual mente no cuenta con el dinero necesario para poder comprar el material y pagarle a la persona que se encargara de realizar la mejora. 
Planea pagar el crédito con el sueldo que recibe de su trabajo como empleado de una agencia aduanal.  
Cuando se realizo la visita a la casa del señor Cesar el se encontraba en su empleo y quien nos atendió fue su esposa la señora Dinora González es la persona que aparecen en la foto.
texts.en:
Cesar L. is very grateful for Kiva's help in his last loan, which allowed him to install electricity in his house. He is now requesting a loan to buy more materials and pay the electrician. He plans to repay his loan with his salary as an employee at a customs agency. Mr. L. was at work during the home visit when this photo was taken. His wife, Dinora González, appears in the photo instead.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Final details for house interior and exterior

loans.name: Lorena Alexandra

texts.es:
Lorena de 31 años, vive en una zona periurbana ubicada en el Fortín de Guayaquil. Ella hace anualidades con fomix y los vende a escuelas y a fiestas. 

Empezó hace 10 años atrás aprender manualidades a base de fomix y cartulina poco a poco quiso que esta actividad sea su principal ingreso, conociendo a gente en fiestas comenzó a promocionar sus manualidades. Hasta ahora que ya tiene clientela fija y trabaja desde las 08h00am hasta las 18h00pm. 

Para poder arreglar su casa y ubicar un lugar para sus manualidades necesita comprar con el préstamo cemento, arena y piedras. En el futuro quiere tener una papelería, y terminar de construir su casa.
texts.en:
Lorena is 31 years old and lives in El Fortín, a periurban zone of Guayaquil. She sells celebration decorations for schools and parties. She began ten years ago by learning to make crafts using cardboard and the supplies from Fomix, and little by little she was able to turn this into her main income source, and she promotes her crafts to people she meets at parties. She now has an established customer base and works from 8:00am until 6:00pm. She needs the loan to buy cement, sand, and stone in order to improve her house and create a place for her crafts. In the future, she wants to have a stationary store and to finish building her home.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Hynd, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: cement, sand, and stone

loans.name: Joaquin

texts.es:
Joaquín tiene 36 años de edad reside en San Miguel, es viudo, tiene dos hijos de las edades de 8 y 15 años los cuales dependen económicamente de él, posee un negocio de confetis y refresco.
Se dedica al comercio por que le permite adquirir más ingresos, trabando de forma independiente, vende a locales particulares, tiendas, el horario es de 7:00am - 6:00pm, los amigos le orientan sobre las zonas de mayor comercio, el está solicitando un préstamo para compra de dulces, jugos, galletas, agua y otros productos para comercializarlos, esto le permitirá continuar con el negocio, generar ingresos para solventar las necesidades de la familia, el riesgo en mínimo ya que el producto no perece y si los precios se mantienen.
Las aspiraciones son generar ingresos para cumplir con los compromisos financieros, apoyar a los hijos con los estudios, trabajar con recursos propios a futuro, mejorar las condiciones de vida de la
texts.en:
Joaquín is 36 years old and lives in Sam Miguel. He is a widower and has two children aged 8 and 15 who are economically dependent on him. He has a business selling refreshments. He does this work because it brings in good income. He works for himself and sells to particular businesses and stores. His work hours are 7:00am-6:00pm. His friends advise him on where the best trade is. He is requesting a loan to buy candy, juices, cookies, water and other supplies to sell. This will enable him to continue his business and generate income to cover the family expenses. The risk is minimal as the products don't perish and the prices are stable. His hopes are to generate revenue so that he can meet his financial commitments, to support his children in their studies, to work with his own resources in the future, and to improve the family's living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Hynd, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy candy, cookies, juices, water and other products to sell.

loans.name: Carlos Mauricio

texts.es:
A la vivienda del señor Carlos Mauricio G. le está haciendo falta la barda alrededor de su casa.
Solicita un préstamo para poder comprar el material ya que el se encargara de realizar la mejora. 
Planea pagar el crédito con el ingreso que obtiene de su trabajo como mensajero de una compañía.
La persona que aparece en la foto es la señora Antonia Hernandez esposa del señor Carlos Mauricio ya que el se encontraba en su trabajo el día de la visita.
texts.en:
Carlos needs a fence to go around his house. He is requesting a loan in order to buy the material as he is in charge of making the improvements. He plans to repay the loan with income from his work as a messenger for a company. The person pictured is Antonia, Carlos' wife, since he was at work the day of the visit.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Hynd, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To build a fence around his house

loans.name: Esvelia

texts.es: Esvelia de 48 años, vive en su casa propia, en compañía de su hijo y su madre anciana. Es profesora en un colegio que queda dentro de su localidad, por lo que durante todo el día trabaja, además su hijo estudia hasta muy tarde, es por ello que ha decidido alquilar su casa a  un grupo de profesoras que instalaron un nido para niños de 1 a 3 años, desde entonces lleva 4 años percibiendo estos ingresos, que es importante para la economía de su familia.  Esvelia se siente muy satisfecha por lo rentable que le ha resultado este negocio, y por tal motivo desea restaurar las paredes de su inmueble para ofrecer mayor comodidad y seguridad a sus inquilinos. Es su primer crédito con MFP, y sabe que este crédito le será muy útil, por lo que se compromete pagar sus cuotas oportunamente. Esvelia tiene planeado invertir el crédito en la compra de materiales de construcción, de ese modo seguir construyendo su casa.
texts.en:
Esvelia is 48 years old and lives in her own home along with her son and elderly mother. She is a teacher at a school located in her area. During the day she works and her son goes to school until very late. Because of this, she decided to rent out her house to a group of teachers who run a daycare for children from 1 to 3 years old. For the past 4 years she has received income from this, which is important for the family´s economy. Esvelia is quite pleased with how profitable the business has turned out to be. For this reason, she would like to fix the walls of her house so that she can offer more comfort and security to her renters. This is her first loan with MFP and she knows the loan will be very useful and promises to pay the installments on time. Esvelia plans to invest the loan in the purchase of construction materials, thereby continuing to build her house.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy construction materials.

loans.name: Amor Y Amistad 1 & 2 Group

texts.en:
Yolanda is the coordinator of her group Amor y Amistad 1 & 2 (Love and Friendship). She makes her home here in a simple structure, living with her parents. She says that her most difficult challenge is to study and get professional knowledge.  In the meantime she plans to continue enjoying cooking and visiting the beach.

Yolanda is excited to be taking her 11th loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She has had her business for almost 6 years, starting with an initiative to have a business, with which she can help her family. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business where she sells gasoline and motor oil on the road close to her home, and to buy clothing to sell. She will use the profits to reinvest in the business and to save, because she wants to improve her standard of living. 

This Esperanza associate began with us because she believes everybody is involved with her in this loan; they are like family. Her  story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti) generally. Her group is located in Samana, a lush rugged peninsula with a nascent tourism industry. This area, like nearly all impoverished areas of the Dominican Republic suffers from unreliable running water (none of which is potable) and electricity.

loans.use: To buy gasoline, motor oil and clothes

loans.name: Grupo Las Brisas 1 & 2 Group

texts.en:
Victoria is the coordinator of her group Grupo Brisas 1 & 2 (Breezes Group). She makes her home here in a simple structure with her long-term partner and 3 children. She says that her most difficult challenges are to work hard in her business and get better at managing to do everything she needs to do, and put a roof over her house.  In the meantime she plans to continue enjoying doing the laundry and cooking.

Victoria is excited to be taking her 3rd loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She has had her business for four years. She started selling underwear, then her clients asked her for clothing. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business by buying clothes like pants, underwear, shirts, and others. She will use the profits to reinvest in her business and finish building her home.
 
This Esperanza associate began with us because she wanted a loan to invest in her business. Her  story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti) generally. Her group is located in the urban slums surrounding Santo Domingo. This area, like nearly all impoverished areas of the Dominican Republic suffers from unreliable running water (none of which is potable) and electricity.

loans.use: To buy pants (women's and men's), underwear, and shirts

loans.name: Elvia Rocio

texts.es:
Elvia de 42 años, vive en la Perimetral de Guayaquil, vende productos Yambal (empresa que ofrece a mujeres emprendedoras comenzar con sus ventas independientes),  su esposo es comerciante informal y tienen tres hijas.  

Desde que la operaron del útero comenzó a trabajar vendiendo cosméticos, desde muy temprano ofreciendo los productos a sus vecinos y amigos, vende perfumes, cremas , desodorantes, ropa,  trabaja desde las 09h00am hasta las 13h00pm para la tener en la tarde tiempo para sus hijas. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar productos Yambal como perfumes, cremas, desodorantes. En el futuro quiere terminar de construir su casa y ser directora Yambal.
texts.en:
Elvia is 42 years old and lives on the outskirts of Guayaquil. She sells products from Yambal (a company that allows entreprenuerial women to become independent sellers). Her husband is an informal trader and they have three daughters. After she had an operation on her uterus, she began selling cosmetics. She works from very early in the day, offering products to neighbors and friends. She sells perfumes, creams, deodorants and clothing and works from 9:00 am until 1:00 pm so that she has time in the afternoons for her daughters. With this loan she would like to buy Yambal products such as perfumes, creams, and deodorants. In the future she want to finish building her house and to become a director in Yambal.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Perfumes, ropa, cremas

loans.name: Gregorio Lupercio

texts.es:
Gregorio de 53 años, tiene un pequeño Cyber, vive en la Perimetral de Guayaquil (zona periurbana, rodeada de un estero salado). 

El comenzó como taxista pero para dale mejor vida a su esposa y dos hijos decidió invertir sus ahorros y comprar computadoras para tener un cyber, como en el sector por donde vive era mucha la demanda, así poco a poco fue incrementando sus ganancias hasta que pudo tener su pequeño cyber. Ahora su esposa le ayuda en el Cyber mientras que el sale a trabajar como taxista. 

Una de los inconvenientes es que en ocasiones se le daña el carro, por eso quiere comprar con el préstamo herramientas y otra parte para arreglarlo, en el futuro quiere tener un Cyber mas grande y una cooperativa de carros.
texts.en:
Gregorio is 53 years old. He has a small internet cafe and lives on the outskirts of Guayaquil (near the urban zone, surrounded by a salt marsh). He started off as a taxi driver but in order to provide better for his wife and two children decided to invest his savings and buy computers so that he could have an internet cafe, because in the area where he lives there was high demand. Little by little his earnings increased until he was able to open his small internet cafe. Now his wife helps out at the internet cafe while he works as a taxi driver. One of the drawbacks is that sometimes the car gets damaged, which is why he wants to buy some tools with part of this loan and use the other part to fix the car. In the future he would like to have a larger internet cafe and a fleet of taxis.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Tools for repairing vehicle.

loans.name: Clavelitos 1 Group

texts.en:
Lucia is the coordinator of her group Clavelitos 1 (Pinks). She makes her home here in a simple structure with her husband and one child. She says that her most difficult challenge is to have a really successful business.  In the meantime she plans to continue enjoying working and cooking.

Lucia is excited to be taking her second loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She has had her business for almost a year, starting with her first loan, after a cousin invited her to be part of the group. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business by buying fruit, milk, sodas, bread, and other items. She makes natural juices, sandwiches and sells groceries. She will use the profits to invest and save because she wants to have an improved and successful business.
 
This Esperanza associate began with us because she liked the program and the knowledge she is getting in her group and at the meetings. Her  story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti) generally. Her group is located in Los Arcarizos, a dusty industrial area north of the capital where free traD. zones are common. This area, like nearly all impoverished areas of the Dominican Republic suffers from unreliable running water (none of which is potable) and electricity.

loans.use: to buy fruit, milk, sodas, bread, etc.

loans.name: Victoria Del Pilar

texts.es:
Victoria de 64 años, vive en una casa de caña ubicada en una zona periurbana en el Fortín Guayaquil,  tiene una papelería, desde hace años para ayudar con los gastos familiares. 

Empezó hace 6 años con una vitrina vendiendo cuadernos y plumas porque no tenia ingresos suficientes invirtió sus ahorros para vender a sus vecinos, poco a poco con esfuerzo y ayuda de sus hijos ahora tiene un papelería, trabaja desde las 07h00 hasta las 20h00pm todos los días.    

Para surtir mas su papelería ella quiere comprar con el préstamo papelería y cuadernos. En el futuro quiere terminar de construir su casa e incrementar su negocio.
texts.en:
Victoria is 64 years old and lives in a house made from cane reed on the outskirts of Fortín Guayaquil. For years she has had a stationery store to help out with family expenses. Because she did not have enough income, six years ago she invested her savings in a display case to sell notebooks and pens to her neighbors. Little by little, through her efforts and with the help of her children, she was able to have a stationery store. She works from 7:00 am to 8:00 pm every day. With this loan she wants to stock her store with more paper and notebooks. In the future she wants to finish building her house and to grow her business.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Notebooks and paper for her store.

loans.name: Filemón

texts.es:
El Sr. Filemón es casado, tiene dos  hijos,  todos  en edad escolar.
Él se dedica a la venta de mercería de forma ambulante  por las colonias, la misma cada vez más está en ascenso, generándole un buen ingreso.
Su actividad consiste en comprar las mercaderías del mercado de la ciudad y salir por las ciudades aledañas para ofrecer y vender a los clientes.
Con la ayuda de su esposa  están  saliendo adelante con mucho sacrificio y esfuerzo.
Hoy día él es un microempresario exitoso con una clientela fiel y numerosa, debido a su amabilidad.
Ha demostrado ser una persona responsable y honesta en sus compromisos por lo que debemos  brindarle todo el apoyo necesario en sus emprendimientos.
El solicita el préstamo para la compra de mercadería en gran cantidad como, harina, fideos, arroz, productos de limpieza, enlatados y poductos de basicos para boticos, y muchos accesorios para el cabello, articulos de libreria,y otros.
texts.en:
Filemón is married and has two school-age children. He is a traveling salesmen in nearby neighborhoods, his sales are increasing and generating a good income. He buys merchandise in the city´s market and then goes out to surrounding cities to offer products and sell to customers. With his wife´s help, they are moving forward with a lot of sacrifice and effort. Today he is a successful businessman with a loyal and large clientele because of his kindness. He has proven to be honest and responsible with his commitments which is why we are giving him all the support he needs for his endeavors. He is requesting a loan to buy bulk quantities of merchandise such as flour, pastas, rice, cleaning products, canned goods and basic goods for drugstores as well as haircare products, stationery supplies and others.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy bulk quantities of flour, oil, cleaning products, canned goods, pastas, rice and basic goods for drugstores, etc.

loans.name: Geranios 1 & 2 Group

texts.en:
Maria is the coordinator of her group Geranios 1 & 2 (Geraniums). She makes her home here in a simple structure with her long term partner and 2 children. She says that her most difficult challenge is having a clothing store.  In the meantime she plans to continue enjoying to share with her family at her home.

Maria is excited to be taking her third loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She has had her business for two years; she started it with some savings and improved it after being invited to a group in her community by a friend. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business by buying clothing and shoes. She will use the profits to get electrical service and to improve her business. She wants in the near future to have a clothing store.
 
This Esperanza associate began with us because "I like the payments plan and interest, also i'm learning how to do business". Her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti) clients generally, her group is located in Los Arcarrizos, a dusty industrial area north of the capital where free trade zones are common. This area, like nearly all impoverished areas of the Dominican Republic, suffers from unreliable running water (none of which is potable) and electricity.

loans.use: buying clothes and shoes

loans.name: Cándido Eligio

texts.es:
El Sr Cándido  es casado,  tiene una pequeña despensa   en el km 8 Monday,  la venta del  mismo es gratificante ya que cuenta con una considerable cantidad de clientes y el ingreso es bastante satisfactorio.

Con la ayuda de su esposa e hijas   están  saliendo adelante con voluntad, trabajo y dedicación.
El es una persona muy trabajadora y responsable y lo ha demostrado con la puntualidad en el pago de sus cuotas y con la honestidad en sus compromisos por lo que debemos brindarle todo el apoyo necesario.
El señor Candido solicita el prestamo para la compra de mercaderias para su despensa, como fidoes, harina, aceite, azúcar y otros productos de consumo familiar.
texts.en:
Cándido is married. He has a small general store at Km. 8 Monday (near Ciudad del Este). The store´s sales are rewarding because he has a number of clients and his income is quite satisfactory. With help from his wife and daughters, they are moving forward with determination, hard work and dedication. He is a very hard worker and responsible, and has shown punctuality with his loan repayments and honesty with his commitments, for this reason we should give him all the support he needs. Cándido is requesting a loan to buy merchandise for his store, such as pastas, flour, oil, sugar and other basic goods.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy pastas, flour, rice, sugar and oil.

loans.name: Haydee

texts.es: Haydee, de 31 años, es una madre de familia muy jovial, vive en su casa propia, junto a su esposo y sus 3 hijos. Hace 9 meses que incursionó en la venta de cosméticos, actividad que lo realiza durante el día. Su modalidad de trabajo es por medio de catalogo y a crédito, cada cierto tiempo acumula los pedidos que le hacen sus clientes, procurando siempre hacer trato con personas responsables en el pago. Haydee está muy satisfecha con el trabajo que hace, ya que gracias a ello pudo conocer mucha gente. En adelante desea ampliar y diversificar su negocio con la venta de ropa por catálogos, ya que dejan mayores utilidades. Este es su primer crédito con MFP, y sabe que es de mucha utilidad para aumentar el capital de su negocio, por ello se compromete en pagar todas sus cuotas oportunamente. Haydee tiene planeado invertir el crédito solicitado en la compra de diferentes productos de belleza, de esta manera piensa abastecerse y ofrecer la mejor variedad de mercaderías a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Haydee, 31 years old, is a very cheerful mother who lives in her own home with her husband and 3 children. Nine months ago she started selling cosmetics, which is something she does during the day. Her way of working is through catalogs and on credit. Every so often she pulls together orders from her customers and always tries to deal with persons who are responsible with ther payments. Haydee is quite pleased with the work she does, since thanks to this she has been able to meet many people. In the future she would like to expand and diversify her business to sell clothing by catalog, since this is more profitable. This is her first loan with MFP and she knows that it is very useful for increasing her business´ working capital. For this reason she is committed to paying her installments on time. Haydee plans to invest her loan in the purchase of various beauty products. This way she plans to have supplies so that she can offer the best variety of merchandise to her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase beauty products

loans.name: Carlos Alejandro

texts.es:
Carlos de 58 años, vive en el suburbio de Guayaquil y vende mariscos como pescados, camarones y conchas tiene dos hijos y uno que falleció.  

Empezó a vender mariscos desde que se caso para tener mas ingresos para su familia, poco a poco compro pescados, camarones etc. Trabaja desde las 08h00am hasta las 17h00pm todos los días. Cada librar de pescado la vende a $ 2.00, la libra de camarones la vende a $ 2.50. 

Para incrementar los mariscos que tiene en su negocio el quiere comprar con el préstamo pescados, conchas y camarones. El nos comento que no quiere afanarse del por venir del mañana por lo que dice la Biblia.
texts.en:
Carlos is 58 years old. He lives in a suburb of Guayaquil and he sells seafood such as fish, shrimp, and oysters. He has two children and one who passed away. He started to sell seafood when he was married in order to have more income for his family. Little by little, he bought fish, shrimp, etc. He works from 8 a.m. until 5 p.m. every day. He sells every pound of fish for $2.00, and a pound of shrimp costs $2.50. In order to increase the amount of seafood he has in his business he wants to buy fish, oysters and shrimp with the loan. He tells us he does not want to be anxious for what tomorrow will bring, as the Bible says.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Fish, oysters

loans.name: Gloria Del Carmen

texts.es:
Gloria tiene 45 años de edad reside en el Municipio de San Francisco Gotera, departamento de Morazán, es madre soltera, tiene dos hijos Rodrigo de 18 años y Griselda de 15, ellos dependen económicamente del negocio de gloria el cual venta de frescos y comida. 
Tiene 15 años de experiencia en el negocio, con ayuda de la hija ella trabaja todos los días de la semana de 9:00 am- 4:00pm, vendiendo frescos y comida, ella  solicita un préstamo para la compra de materiales para hacer freso de Horchata (elaborado de morro, ajonjolí, maní y otros) esto le permitirá continuar con el negocio, generar los ingresos necesarios para cubrir los gastos familiares.
Las  aspiraciones de Gloria son cumplir con puntualidad los pagos de este préstamo y a futuro mejorar las condiciones de la vivienda, mejorar las condiciones de vida de la familia
texts.en:
Gloria is 45 years old. She lives in the town of San Francisco Gotera, Morazán department. She is a single mother with two children; Rodrigo, 18 and Griselda, 15. The depend financially on Gloria's business, which is selling food and beverages. She has 15 years of experience in the business. With her daughter's help, she works every day fron 9:00 a.m. to 4:00 p.m selling food and beverages. She is asking for a loan in order to buy ingredients to make the horchata drink (made from morro seed, sesame seed, peanuts and more). This will allow her to continue with her business and generate the income necessary to cover family expenses. Gloria aspires to making her payments on time for this loan and in the future improve her living conditions, and her family's quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Ingredients to make the horchata drink (made from morro seeds, sesame seeds, peanuts and more)

loans.name: Amancaes Group

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “AMANCAES ”; El banco comunal está ubicado en el distrito de Huanchac, provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. L., ella tiene 33 años de edad, es soltera; La socia se dedica a administrar su consultorio odontológico, situado en la calle tullumayu, La socia desea  comprar instrumentos para implementar su consultorio.  La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en su consultorio odontológico.     
Los otros socios son docentes, contadores, secretaria y administrador, en su mayoría ellos invertirán en sus negocios anexos como venta de cosméticos por catálogos en sus instituciones, mantenimiento de autos, implementar internet en casa.             .

La socia agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete en cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the "AMANCAES" communal bank, which is located in the Huanchac district, in the province and department of Cusco. The member, Mrs. L., is 33 years old and single. She manages a dental office located on Tullumayu Street. She would like to buy instruments for the office and is requesting a loan to invest in the dentist office. The other members are teachers, accountants, a secretary and an administrator. Most of them will invest in their other businesses, such as selling cosmetics by catalog at their institutions, car maintenance, setting up an internet cafe at home. This member is grateful for and appreciates the loan and promises to meet the payment of installments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in their businesses

loans.name: Maxima

texts.es: Máxima, de 37 años, es una madre de familia muy emprendedora, vive en su casa propia, junto a su esposa y sus 3 hijos. Hace más de 7 años se dedica en la venta de productos comestibles durante todo el día, en pequeño espacio que ambientó en el primer piso de su casa. Asimismo prepara jugos, extractos de frutas y especias molidas que son ofrecidos a primera hora de la mañana a sus clientes, quienes en su mayoría son amas de casa. Su bodega es la más concurrida de su barrio,  por el trato sencillo y jovial que les brinda a sus compradores, de ese modo los mantiene contentos. Se siente satisfecha por el negocio que realiza, sin descuidar de sus hijos. En adelante anhela ampliar  y diversificar  su negocio, con la venta de artículos de bazar, ya que por su barrio nadie se dedica a ese rubro. Es su primer crédito con MFP, ya que sabe que le será de mucha utilidad para aumentar el capital de su negocio, por lo que se compromete pagar todas sus cuotas a tiempo. Con el crédito que solicita, se incrementará de productos perecibles, de ese modo podrá aumentar sus ganancias.
texts.en:
Máxima, 37, is a very enterprising mother. She lives in her own house with her husband and their three children. For more than seven years she has worked selling groceries all day long, in a small space that she set up on the first floor of her house. She also makes juices, extracts of fruits and and ground spices which are offered first thing in the morning to her customers, who are mostly housewives. Her store is the best attended in her neighborhood because of the simple and cheerful manner in which she treats her neighbors. In this way she keeps them happy. She is satisfied with the business she carries out without neglecting her children. In the future, she wants to expand and diversify her business by selling stationery items because no one in her neighborhood works in this area. This is her first loan with MFP because she knows it will be very helpful to her in increasing her capital for her business. For this reason she promises to make all her payments on time. With the loan she is requesting, she will increase her stock of perishable products, and in this way she will be able to increase her earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Danielle Maxson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Perishable products

loans.name: Jesus Es Prosperidad Group

texts.en:
Johanna is the coordinator of her group Jesus es Prosperidad 1 (Jesus is Prosperity). She makes her home here in a simple structure with her long term partner and a child. She says that her most difficult challenge is to raise her child.  In the meantime she plans to continue enjoying cooking and spending time with her family.

Johanna is excited to be taking her third loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She has had her business for 3 years, starting with her first loan. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business by buying underwear, cosmetics and shoes. She will use the profits to buy her children school's supplies and buy some couches for her home. She is dreaming to have her own house and to improve her business.
 
This Esperanza associate began with us because after having other loans she found the Esperanza program in her community and prefers our rates. Her  story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti) clients generally; her group is located in Santiago, an area famous for tobacco and beef production, the second biggest city in the Dominican Republic,. This area, like nearly all impoverished areas of the Dominican Republic, suffers from unreliable running water (none of which is potable) and electricity.

loans.use: to buy underwear, cosmetics and shoes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy tools and supplies for lock business.

loans.name: Marino

texts.es:
El Sr. Marino  es casado con la señora  Olinda hace varios años, una  hija menor  que aún está cursando la escuela primaria.
Marino es taxista; tiene un vehículo propio que había comprado con  mucho esfuerzo.
Además de su trabajo, Olinda trabaja como vendedora  de ropas que trae de la Argentina y el Brasil  para ayudar a su marido con los gastos del hogar. Ellos viven en casa propia.
Gracias al trabajo que están realizando educan a su hija, y compran todas las necesidades de su hogar.
Él ha demostrado ser una persona muy responsable y honesta en sus compromisos.

Hemos confiado en don Marino en otros créditos anteriores  y ha cumplido con total cabalidad con sus compromisos.
Ella es una persona muy responsable y con ganas de superación, tiene un espíritu jovial y emprendedor que no cabe duda que va a llegar a conseguir todas las metas que se ha propuesto y solicita el préstamo para la reparación de su taxi.
texts.en:
Sr. Marino and his wife, Sra. Olinda, have been married for several years. They have a young daughter who is in elementary school. Marino drives a cab and, after much hard work, he managed to buy a vehicle that he now owns. Olinda also has a business, selling clothing that she brings from Argentina and Brazil. The revenues from her business help meet the family's expenses. The couple own their house and, thanks to their hard work, they can give their daughter an education and buy the everyday things they need to live. Marino has demonstrated that he is responsible and honest about his commitments. We have trusted Marino with other loans in the past and he has met all the commitments he has made to us. Olinda, too, is a responsible person with a strong drive to get ahead in the world. Marino has an open and entrepreneurial spirit that leaves us in no doubt that he will meet the goals that he's set. Marino will use the loan to repair his cab.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Vehicle repairs for taxi business.

loans.name: Yofanny

texts.es:
Yofanny es una madre de familia de 29 años de edad que vive junto a su esposo y a sus tres hijos en el caserío Cruce de Vega, una zona rural del distrito grícola de Tambogrande, zona productora de frutas para exportación que pertenece a la provincia de Piura y se encuentra ubicada en la región del mismo nombre, amás de tres horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica a trabajar criando y vendiendo animales menores, ella cría cerdos y aves de corral en diversos ambientes ubicados cerca a su vivienda, cuando estos han alcanzado un buen nivel de desarrollo los ofrece en venta a sus vecinos y negociantes que visitan con frecuencia lazona en donde vive. Con los ingresos que percibe de esta actividad ella ayuda a su esposo, que es agricultor, con los gastos económicos familiares.

Yofanny desea invertir capital en la alimentación de sus animales, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 600 nuevos soles que piensa invertir en la compra de alimento balanceado, esta inversion le permitirá percibir mayores ingresos al momento de vender sus animales ya que con el alimento que consumirán hará que se desarrollen de modo correcto.

Yofanny es una mujer tranquila, alegre y hogareña. En la zona donde vive sus vecinos y conocidos le consideran una mujer responsable y de confianza. Su mayor anhelo es eguir trabajando para poder brindar a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Yofanny, 29, lives with her husband and their three children in Tambogrande, a rural area of Peru largely given over to growing fruit for export. Tambogrande is in the province of Piura, in the region of the same name, about three hours from Chiclayo, the capital of the region of Lambayeque. Yofanny earns a living raising and selling animals. She raises poultry and pigs behind and around her house and when they are ready for market, she sells them to neighbors or buyers who travel through the area from time to time. The income from the business allows Yofanny to help her husband, a farmer, with the family's expenses. Yofanny wants to use the loan to buy animal feed. She is applying to Edpyme Alternativa for a 600 new soles loan that she plans to use to buy feed that will improve the diet of the animals. The investment will increase the income that she gets when she sells the animals because the improved feed will contribute to their better development. Yofanny is happy with herself and her family. Her neighbors and acquaintances consider her to be a responsible and trustworthy person. Her greatest wish is to continue working and helping her family improve their quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy animal feed for animal sales business.

loans.name: Reyna Isabel

texts.es: La señora Reyna  se dedica a la venta de comida diaria  junto con sus Padres, también vende un plato especial los fines de semanas ella prepara el  conocido como chicharrón de cerdo este es un plato tipico d ela ciudad de Cochabamba y lo hacen en uno peroles grandes como se muestra en la foto, la cliente desea el crédito para poder comprase un pequeño refrigerador y así tener conservados sus verdura y su carne que compra para preparar sus comidas; ella es una mujer emprendedora que trabaja como padre y madre para sus hijas ya que su esposo se fue del país y a veces les envía algo de dinero y otros meses no les envía nada, ella se siente con un compromiso grande con sus hijas, ya que su sueño es sacarles adelante y que puedan estudiar. Y algún día verlas profesionales.
texts.en:
Reyna works selling daily meals alongside her parents. At the weekends, she also sells a special dish called "chicarrón de cerdo" which means "pork rinds" and is a speciality of the city of Cochabamba. She makes this in big pots, as shown in the photo. She wants the loan so that she can buy a small refrigerator that will preserve the vegetables and meat that she buys to prepare the meals. She is an enterprising woman who works as both father and mother for her daughters as her husband left the country and sometimes sends them money but some months does not send them anything. She feels a great responsibility for her daughters and her dream is to help them be successful and that they can study and one day be professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Hynd, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a refrigerator

loans.name: Magalis Maria

texts.es:
Magalis María M. es una mujer joven y abnegada madre, de un pequeño hijo de 5 años de edad, que vive en el barrio Olaya de la ciudad de Cartagena, cuna de la música caribeña y donde florecen en sus calles, de manera silvestre  bailarines y cantantes  de champeta y reguetón de todas las edades que cada día agregan nuevos ritmos a la música Colombiana;  ella  es propietaria de la comercializadora M. donde vende pescado, carnes blancas y por otro lado vende  mercancías como cremas dentales, cremas para manos y cuerpo y cosméticos en general.

Este es su segundo crédito con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo y con él comprará pollo, pescado, atún, enlatados y productos de higiene personal como cremas dentales, y jabones. Magaly está entusiasmada con su credikiva, su  segundo crédito porque el anterior que le hizo la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, le generó un gran impuso para su negocio y con ellos sus utilidades le ayudaron a  mejorar  aspectos de su vida y la de su familia. Su mayor desafío es lograr tener un local con buenos esquemas de refrigeración y también convertirse en una gran mayorista de estas delicias proteinicas, para ver convertido en el futuro a su unigénito  en una persona  de bien y muy exitosa.
texts.en:
Magalis María M. is a young woman and the self-sacrificing mother of a small five year old son. She lives in the Olaya neighborhood in the city of Cartagena. This city is the cradle of Caribbean music. Everyday dancers and reggaeton and champeta singers of all ages wildly flourish in the city streets. Each day they add new rhythms to Columbian music. She is the proprietor of the Comercializadora M. business, where she sells fish and white meats. She also sells toothpaste, hand and body creams, and general cosmetics. This is her second loan with the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. She will use the loan to buy chicken, fish, tuna, canned goods, and personal hygiene products like toothpaste and soap. Magaly is enthusiastic about her Kiva loan, her second loan, because the last one was from the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. It generated a great boost for her business. Her profits helped her to improve aspects of her life and those of her family. Her greatest challenge is managing to have a place with a good refrigeration set up. She also wants to become a large wholesale seller of these protein delicacies. In the future she wants to see her only child become a good and very successful person.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy chicken, fish, tuna, canned goods, and personal hygiene products like toothpaste and soap

loans.name: Maria Esmeralda

texts.es:
L. señora Maria Esmeralda D. L. R. tiene ya mas D. ocho años dedicándose a L. venta D. ropa usada en diferentes partes D. L. ciudad.
Al negocio le esta haciendo falta mas variedad D. mercancía pero por el momento no cuenta con el dinero necesario para poder invertir, es por eso que está solicitando un préstamo y así poder tener suficiente mercancía para L. venta.
Planea pagar el crédito con una parte D. las ganancias que obtiene D. su negocio ya que es madre soltera y tiene dos hijos bojo su responsabilidad.
texts.en:
Maria Esmeralda D. L. R. has been selling used clothes in different parts of the city for over eight years. The business needs a greater variety of merchandise, but at this time she does not have the money that is needed to be able to invest in the business. That is why she is requesting a loan to be able to have enough merchandise to sell. She plans on paying the loan with part of the earnings she gets from her business. She is a single mother, and she has two children for whom she is responsible.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise

loans.name: Santa Barbara Group

texts.es:
La Asociación Comunal “Santa Bárbara” es un grupo antiguo, está iniciando su ciclo número 28, es parte del Centro Focal de Santiago II, cuenta con ocho integrantes, a la cabeza de la misma se encuentra una mesa directiva compuesta por Presidenta, Tesorera y Secretaria, de acuerdo a la norma de la institución.  

La  presidenta, doña Nancy se dedica la elaboración de ropa para bebé, estudió tejido a máquina y poco a poco “levantó su negocio”, actualmente son 20 años que desarrolla esta actividad.   Este es su noveno ciclo como parte de la asociación “Santa Bárbara”. Su primer crédito de Bs.1000.- le sirvió para comprar lana, la solicitud actual es por Bs.3000.-, el mismo que también invertirá en la compra de lana, en diferentes colores y texturas.  Una vez elaborada la ropa de bebé ella la vende en una Feria llamada “Tihuanacu” los días jueves y sábado de horas  cuatro a siete de la noche.

Así como doña Nancy ha establecido su negocio , el resto de las socias también tienen los suyos,entre ellos tenemos: elaboración de Deportivos, venta de lana de alpaca y oveja, venta de ropa de bebé, venta de chompas, venta de detergentes, bordados, venta de artículos varios.
texts.en:
The Santa Bárbara Communal Bank is a long-standing group. The group is starting its 28th cycle as part of the Santiago II Community Center. There are eight members. It is headed by the board of directors comprised of the president, treasurer, and the secretary; which is the norm for the institution. Nancy is the president. She makes baby clothes. She studied knitting with a machine, and little by little she “raised her business”. She has been in this business for 20 years. This is her ninth cycle as part of the Santa Bárbara Communal Bank. She used her first loan for 1,000 Bs to buy wool. Her current request is for 3,000 Bs, which she will also use to buy different colors and textures of wool. Once she has made the baby clothes she sells them in the Tihuanacu fair on Thursdays and Saturdays from four to seven at night. As Nancy has established her business, the rest of the members have also established theirs. Among them is making sportswear, selling wool from alpacas and sheep, selling baby clothes, selling sweaters, selling detergents, embroidery, and selling various things.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy different colors of wool wholesale

loans.name: Ines Loena

texts.es:
Inés de 36 años, vive en una zona urbana en el suburbio de Guayaquil, ella confecciona ropa como pantalones, blusas todos los días

Su mama le enseño a coser y a confeccionar ropa. Comenzando con una maquina de coser vieja pudo tener suficientes clientes para solventar sus gastos. Trabaja todos los días en su casa confeccionando pantalones, vestidos, blusas a sus clientes y así tener ingresos suficientes para darles una mejor vida a sus cuatro hijos de 20,16, 13, 9 años.

Para continuar con su taller de confección de ropa ella quiere comprar con el préstamo ropa y hilos en el futuro quiere construir mejor su casa y tener mas grande el taller de confección y costura.
texts.en:
Inés is 36 years old and lives in an urban area of Guayaquil, a suburb. Every day she is busy sewing clothing like pants and blouses. Her mother taught her how sew. She began with one old sewing machine which permitted her to have only as many clients as would support her expenses. Working every day in her home, she makes pants, dresses, and blouses for her customers. She makes enough money to give her four children, ages 20, 16, 13 and 9, a better life. In order for her to continue with her home business, she would like to purchase cloth and threads with her micro-finance loan. In the future she would like to be about to improve her home and to have a larger work room to sew in.

Translated from Spanish by Kristin Connor, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Cloth and threads

loans.name: Lizeth America

texts.es: La Señora Lizeth se dedica a la venta de comida por las noches lo cual la señora trabaja a partir de las 6 de la tarde hasta las 12 de la noche, vive en casa de su mamá que también trabaja con emprender en bancos de emprendimiento, su domicilio se encuentra ubicado en la avenida Blanco Galindo kilometro 8, la señora Lizeth esta muy pero muy agradecida con la tasa preferencial kiva y con emprender por el apoyo que se le dio, el destino del crédito con tasa kiva fue para poder compra una broastera mediana para producir un rico pollo a la broaster, y así tener un mejor ingreso, y poder ayudar a su madre en los ingresos de la casa.
texts.en:
Ms. Lizeth sells food every night from 6pm until midnight. She lives with her mother, who also works with micro-financing loans. Their home is on the Avenida Blanco Galindo. Ms. Lizeth is very thankful for the support she has received from the micro-financing loans. She plans on using the money she receives to buy a medium sized fryer, so that she can make fried chicken and make more money so that she can help her mother with household expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Kristin Connor, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy  a fryer

loans.name: Ada

texts.es: Ada tiene 43 años, vive con sus 3 hijos en una casa alquilada. Casi toda su vida ha trabajado en la elaboración de pan, negocio el cual le fue heredado por su padre, desde entonces lo administra. Lleva 40 años de funcionamiento, teniendo como socios a sus propios hermanos, que juntos elaboran pan, pasteles y galletas, que luego son ofrecidos a los diversos establecimientos pasteleros. Disfruta de su trabajo porque le permite ser una empresaria, y eso le da satisfacción personal. En adelante esta viendo la manera de adquirir maquinaria nueva para incrementar la productividad que le permitirá tener más ganancias. Es su tercer crédito con MFP, esta muy contenta de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero ya que siempre ha demostrado  ser responsable en sus pagos, además  le agrada ser parte de su grupo comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias, agradece  a aquellas personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita y le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la adquisición de nueva maquinaria como su batidora de masa.
texts.en:
Ada is 43 years old. She lives with her 3 children in a rented house. She has worked almost her entire life making bread. She inherited the business from her father, and has run it ever since. It has been in operation for 40 years. Her partners are her own siblings and together they make bread, pastries and cookies which they later offer to various pastry establishments.
