Her loan will be invested in purchasing foodstuff for her business to continue growing, and this is her principal goal. Rosa lives in the community of La Virginia in Paute canton. She is 45 years old, single, and has a 19 year old son who studies in a rural 'school by satellite' and works in agriculture. She too lacks her own home and lives in her parents' house. Rosa takes care of the house and raises animals, including guinea pigs, pigs, and chickens, and also works in agriculture. She has a business selling vegetables in the Paute market but only on Sundays. This is her 3rd loan with the Foundation, and she will invest it in her vegetable business. Her dream is to finally have her own house.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: BUYING MEAT, FISH, RICE, COOKING OIL, PRODUCE AND VEGETABLES TO SELL

loans.name: Liliana

texts.es:
Liliana es una madre de familia de 28 años de edad que vive en el caserío Cruceta Centro, una zona rural del distrito agrícola de Tambogrande,  zona productora de frutas para exportación que se encuentra ubicada en la provincia de Piura, en la región del mismo nombre, situada a mas de tres horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica a la venta de productos de primera necesidad y abarrotes en una bodega – tienda instalada en su domicilio, allí ella ofrece a sus vecinos y clientes todo tipo de productos de uso diario que muchas veces no tienen al alcance de la mano. El negocio goza de muy buena acogida debido al trato que brinda y a la calidad de productos que ofrece, con los ingresos que percibe de esta actividad ella ayuda a su esposo, quien trabaja en el sur del País, con el sostenimiento familiar.

Liliana desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de más productos de modo que pueda incrementar su nivel de ventas y percibir mayores ingresos, para lograr su objetivo se ha visto en la necesidad de solictar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles. 

Ella es una mujer bastante trabajadora y entregada a su familia. Su mayor anhelo es seguir creciendo como empresaria y tener a su esposo trabajando cerca para mantener a su familia reunida.
texts.en:
Liliana is a 28-year-old mother living in Cruceta Centro, a rural area of the agricultural district of Tambogrande, known for growing fruit for export located in Piura province, Piura region, three hours from the city of Chiclayo, Lambayeque region’s capital. She has a general store in her home where she stocks basic needs items. She offers her neighbors and customers all kinds of daily use products that they sometimes don’t have near at hand. The store is well received thanks to the customer service and quality of products she provides. Income from this activity helps her husband, who works in the south of the country, to support the family. Liliana hopes to increase her store’s stock with more products so that her sales level will rise and thus earn higher profits. To reach this goal she found herself needing to request a loan for the first time from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 1500 new soles. She is quite a hard working woman who is dedicated to her family. Her greatest wish is to continue to grow as a businesswoman and to have her husband working near in order to maintain her family united.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy stock items for her store.

loans.name: Amanecer (Flat) Group

texts.es:
La señora Soraida Pérez Pérez vive en coapilla Estado de Chiapas México, tiene cuarenta y cuatro años de edad, está casada con el señor julio cesar Pérez Patricio, en la cual no tuvo la oportunidad de tener hijos pero a un así está muy feliz y agradecida con dios por darle un hogar.

   Ella se dedica a la venta de pollos para venderlos en pie, pero hace unos meses comenzó con la actividad de un club nutricional, para que así obtenga más ingresos en su hogar de las dos actividades que realiza.

  Comenta que la razón del cual se decidió por esta actividad es porque dice que de ahí se invierte pero se obtiene más ganancias, así apoyar a sus padres con los gastos pequeños que realizan ya que están avanzados de edad y no quiere que trabajen mucho.

  Solicito el préstamo para comprar mas medicinas y tener surtido su negocio, como también comprar pollos para que obtenga ingresos de los dos y no se vea limitada con los gastos que realiza día a día a un así su esposo la apoya trabajando en el campo sembrando maíz y frijol para luego venderlo y juntos paguen el préstamo que fundación realidad le ha otorgado.

   Con las ganancias que obtenga de sus negocios piensa ahorrar para construir una casa más amplia para vivir cómoda y con el tiempo  también tener un local donde vender sus productos.

    Las personas que integran el grupo amanecer y cada una con diferente actividad son:
Brígida Pérez E.: invertirá el préstamo en la venta de pollos para venderlo aliñados (destazados).

 Candelaria V. Hernández: se dedica a al negocio de productos agrícolas.

 Inés Romana López García: lo invertirá en la venta de antojitos como son: tamales, tacos, empanadas, tostadas, entre otros.
 Soraida Pérez Pérez: es la señora que se le tomo la entrevista e invertirá el préstamo para comprar productos medicinales.
texts.en:
Soraida Pérez Pérez lives in Coapilla, in the state of Chiapas, México. She is forty-four years old and married to Julio Cesar Pérez Patricio. She has not had the opportunity to have children, but even so, she is very happy and thankful to God for giving her a home. Her work is selling live chickens. However, a few months ago, she began an additional activity, a nutritional club [offering natural medicines], so that she can obtain more income for her household from the two activities she carries out. She comments that the reason she decided upon this activity was that it requires some investment but produces higher profits, and so she can help her parents with their small expenses, since they are advanced in age and she does not want them to have to work very much. She is requesting the loan to buy more medicines and stock her business, and also to buy chickens so she can obtain income from her two businesses, so that she will not be limited by the expenses she has to pay each day. Her husband supports her by working in agriculture, growing corn and beans to sell, and together they will pay off the loan that the Realidad Foundation has granted to Soraida. With the earnings she obtains from her businesses, she plans to save up to construct a larger home, so that she can live comfortably, and in the future, she would also like to have a store where she can sell her products. The members of the Amanecer ["Dawn"] group each pursue a different business activity. They are: Brígida Pérez E.: she will invest the loan in selling butchered and pre-seasoned chickens. Candelaria V. Hernández: her business is selling agricultural products. Inés Romana López García: she will invest in selling snack foods such as tamales, tacos, empanadas, tostadas and others. Soraida Pérez Pérez: she is the member who was interviewed, and she will invest the loan in buying medicinal products.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying medicines for her nutritional club

loans.name: El Paraiso (Flat) Group

texts.es:
La  señora María de Lourdes Gomes Domínguez, vive en Tecpatán Estado de Chiapas México, es casada con el señor Abildai Muñoz Gómez, y tiene un hijo de siete años de nombre Tahaylí Muñoz y le dicen (el bebe) por ser el único, es muy inteligente y quiere ser doctor para apoyar a su pueblo.

  Ella se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras que inicio hace unos meses, en donde comenta que le va bien a un que el espacio es pequeño obtiene buen resultado, así también tiene el negocio de abarrotes que también lo inicio hace poco y de las dos actividades obtenga ingresos para su familia.

   El motivo por el cual solicito el préstamo con fundación realidad a.c, es para comprar mas mercancia y tener surtido su negocio  para que  tenga más clientela y su negocio crezca día a día.

  Con la ganancia que tenga de su negocio lo invertirá para comprar más mercancía, como también pagar el préstamo que solicito con fundación realidad a.c, a un así también cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo que trabaja para que juntos aporten en su hogar.

   Su sueño de María  de Lourdes es tener un local propio para que pueda vender mejor y día con dio crezca, pero lo más grande es apoyar a su hijo para que tenga una profesión y tenga un mejor futuro.

  Lourdes formo parte del grupo ya que se izo  una promoción en su localidad y se intereso invito a sus compañeros a integrarse al programa, el grupo se llama el paraíso la razón del nombre es porque el barrio donde vive así se llama.

 
Las personas que integran el grupo el paraíso son la siguiente:

 María de Lourdes Gómez Domínguez: invertirá para surtir su negocio de  frutas y legumbres, como también de abarrotes.
 Víctor Manuel Gómez Domínguez: invertirá el préstamo en la tienda de abarrotes.
 Catalina O. A.: se dedica a la compra i venta de pollos para venderlo en pie y aliñados (destazados).
texts.en:
Mrs. María de Lourdes Gomes Domínguez lives in Tecpatán, Chiapas, México. She is married to Mr. Abildai Muñoz Gómez and has a 7-year-old son named, Tahaylí Muñoz, called “El Bebé” because he’s an only son. He is very intelligent and wants to become a doctor to help his town. She sells fruits and vegetables, an activity se began a few months ago. She tells us that she does well even though the space she has is small. She also has a small grocery store that she began a short time ago and from both activities she earns income for her family. The reason why she asked for funding from Fundación Realidad, A.C. is to buy merchandise to stock her store so that she can have more customers and her business will grow daily. Profits from the store will be used to buy more merchandise as well as to repay the loan she asked from Fundación Realidad, A.C. She also counts with support from her husband so that they support their home together. María de Lourdes’ dream is to own her own locale so that she can sell better and grow daily. But her biggest dream is to support her son so that he will have a profession and a better future. Lourdes became a member of the group when a promotional offer was made in her locality and she became interested. She invited her companions to join the program. The group is called El Paraíso (Paradise) so named because that’s the name of the neighborhood they live in. The group members are: María de Lourdes Gómez Domínguez: will use the loans to stock her store with fruits and vegetables as well s some grocery items. Víctor Manuel Gómez Domínguez: will invest the loan in his grocery store. Catalina O. A.: sells live and butchered chickens.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fruits and vegetables as well as groceries like sugar, cooking oil and beans, among others.

loans.name: San Miguel (Flat) Group

texts.es:
La señora Guadalupe E. García, vive  en el Barrio San Miguel, en Copainala Estado de Chiapas México. Tiene tres hijos: dos mujeres y un varón: Yessenia, Maricela y Juan Dagoberto quien cada uno ya están casados y son padres de familia.

  Ella se dedica a la comercialización desde hace veinticinco años, en cual comenta que con esta actividad a salido adelante con su familia pues a aun que es pequeño le ha dado buenos resultados en los ingresos de su hogar y con ello también apoyo a sus hijos para terminar su carrera.

   Lo que lo motivo a solicitar el préstamo en fundación realidad a.c, es para comprar más producto y aumentar su negocio y comprar cosas de mejor  calidad, para que su clientela se sienta segura de lo que compra, comenta que se siente muy contenta con este trabajo yaqué está en buen lugar y la gente la prefiere por las atenciones que les brinda.

  Con las ganancias que obtiene de su negocio, lo invierte comprando más mercancía y así  no estar limitada en su venta y con la inversión obtener mejores ganancia, para poder ahorrar y ofrecerle lo mejor a sus netos que son su adoración y su razón de seguir adelante.

    Comenta que su sueño es construir le a cada uno de sus nietos un hogar para cuando estén grandes ya tenga donde vivir, pero lo más importante para ella es que todos termine una carrera y tengan mejores logros en la vida  ya que para eso tienen su apoyo hasta que dios le preste vida.

    El grupo se llama san miguel y está conformado de cuatro señoras, la razón del nombre es porque así se llama el barrio donde ella vive,  y formo parte del grupo por su hija Yessenia quien es  la representante del grupo.  
Las integrantes del grupo san miguel son:

 Yessenia N. E.: invertirá el préstamo en la compra de catálogos de zapatos para hacer pedidos.
 María de Jesús Velásquez Sánchez: utilizara el préstamo para surtir su tienda de ropa con mejor calidad.
 Guadalupe E. García: invertirá el préstamo en su tienda de comercio y es la que se le tomo la entrevista para el programa de kiva.
 María Piedad Velásquez Hernández: invertirá el préstamo en la compra de catalogo de avon y de zapatos.
texts.en:
Guadalupe E. García lives in the San Miguel neighborhood of Copainala, in the state of Chiapas, México. She has three children, two daughters and one son: Yessenia, Maricela and Juan Dagoberto, all of whom are married and have their own children. She has operated a store for the past 25 years. She comments that with this activity, she has been able to help her family get ahead. Although her store is small, it has given her good results as far as income for her household, and with this, she has also supported her children in finishing their education. What has motivated her to request the loan from the Realidad Foundation is the need to buy more products and expand her business, and to buy higher-quality products, so that her customers will feel confident about the items they buy from her. She comments that she feels very satisfied with this work, since the store is in a good location, and she is popular among customers for the service she provides. With the earnings she obtains from her business, she will invest in buying more merchandise, so that she will not be limited in the amount she can sell, and with this investment she will obtain better profits, so that she can save and do the best she can for her grandchildren, whom she adores and who are her reason for continuing. She comments that her dream is to build a home for each one of her grandchildren, so that when they grow up, they will already have a place to live; however, the most important thing for her is that all of them finish their studies and have significant achievements in life, and for this reason, they will have her support as long as God grants her life. The group is called "San Miguel," and it is made up of four women. The group has this name because it is the name of the neighborhood where they live. Guadalupe joined the group thanks to her daughter Yessenia, who is the group's representative. The members of the San Miguel group are: Yessenia N. E.: she will invest the loan in buying shoe catalogs so she can take orders. María de Jesús Velásquez Sánchez: she will use the loan to stock her store with higher-quality clothing. Guadalupe E. García: she will invest the loan in her store, and she was the one interviewed for the Kiva program. María Piedad Velásquez Hernández: she will invest the loan in buying Avon and shoe catalogs.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying merchandise to stock her store, such as pencils, pencil cases and notebooks, among other items

loans.name: San Juditas Group

texts.es:
La señora Ilda A. N., vive en coapilla Estado de Chiapas México, está casada con el señor Eliecer Sánchez y con quien procreo dos hijos varones que a un están a su cargo: Kevin Marconi de nueve años, y marvin Mauricio de siete años le dicen (mauri), y está  muy orgullosa de ellos pues son el motivo de trabajar para darles lo necesario en su crecimiento.

     Ella se dedica a su hogar y solicito el préstamo para  la compra de materiales para la herrería donde elaboran puertas, ventanas y portones, en la cual practica su esposo desde hace ocho años y lo apoyara con esta inversión para que lo trabajen así obtengan mejores ingresos en su familia.
 
   Comenta que con las ganancias que obtenga de la herrería lo invertirá en comprar más materiales así su esposo no se limite con en trabajo y día a día se incremente mas, así también sacar de eso mismo para pagar el préstamo solicitado.

 El sueño que ella tiene es que su herrería a aumente día con día y de ello obtener ahorros para apoyar a sus  hijos a que  estudien y tengan una profesión para un mejor futuro y  del cual puedan trabajar y depender en la vida.
 Ilda formo parte del grupo por una invitación que le izo  la señora María gloria que es la representante del grupo a unirse con ella a solicitar un préstamo y fuera parte del programa. El grupo se llama san juditas la razón del nombre es porque ellas tienen un santito de san judas  y es muy milagros pues trae buena suerte a todo negocio. 
   Las personas que integran el grupo de San Juditas son:
 María ilda A. N.: utilizara el préstamo para comprar materiales para la herrería.
 Esther Sánchez Pérez: se dedica a la elaboración de quesos y necesita el préstamo para la compra de leche.
 María gloria Rodríguez Sánchez: utilizara el préstamo para la compra de cosméticos como son: labiales, perfumes, cremas entre otros.
texts.en:
Ilda A. N. lives in Coapilla in the state of Chiapas, Mexico. She is married to Eliecer Sánchez and together they have two sons: Kevin, 9, and Marvin Mauricio, 7, who is called Mauri. Ilda is very proud of them and the reason she works is to provide for them as they grow. Ilda works in her home and is requesting a loan so that she can buy materials for a blacksmith workshop where doors, windows, and gates are made. Her husband has worked as a blacksmith for the past eight years and this loan will support him so they can increase their family's income.

She says that their profits from the workshop will be invested in buying more materials so that her husband is not limited with his work and can make more each day and be able to repay the loan. Ilda dreams for the workshop's business to grow day by day and to have savings to support her sons so that they can go to school and find a job so they can support themselves.

Ilda forms part of a group that was created by Maria Gloria, who is the group representative. They joined together to be able to apply for loans. The group is called San Juditas because they have a figurine of San Judas which brings luck to their businesses. The members of the group include: 1. María Ilda A. N., who will use the loan to buy materials for a blacksmith workshop; 2. Esther Sánchez Pérez, who makes cheese and will use the loan to buy mik; and 3. María Gloria Rodríguez Sánchez, who will use the loan to buy cosmetics such as lipsticks, perfumes, creams, etc.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Sindewald, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy blacksmithing materials, milk, and cosmetics

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
Julia tiene 45 años de edad, es casada y tiene cinco hijos aún menores. Vive junto a su familia en el Caserío Jesús del Valle – Valle de los Incas, una zona rural del distrito agrícola de Tambogrande,  zona productora de frutas para exportación que se encuentra ubicada en la provincia de Piura, en la región del mismo nombre, situada a mas de tres horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica desde que se casó a la crianza y venta de animales, ella cría animales menores como aves de corral y ovinos en unos ambientes sutiados cerca a su vivienda. Una vez que han alcanzado un buen punto de desarrollo los ofrece en venta a los negociantes que siempre frecuentan la zona en donde vive. Adicionalmente se dedica también a la preparación y venta de chicha (bebida típica de la región hecha a base de harina de maíz) en su domicilio.

Con los ingresos que ella percibe de esta actividad se encarga de ayudar a su esposo, que es agricultor, con los gastos familiares. Ella desea mejorar la alimentación de sus animales para así poder obtener mayores ingresos al momento de venderlos, para realizar su objetivo se ha propuesto adquirir alimento balanceado, por este motivo ha solicitado por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 800 nuevos soles.

Julia es una mujer alegre y responsable. Su mayor anhelo es seguir trabajando para ayudar a su esposo a brindarle a sus hijos una mejor calidad de vida. En la zona donde vive sus vecinos y conocidos le consideran una mujer tranquila y confiable.
texts.en:
Julia is 45 years old. She is married and has five children who are still underage. She lives with her family in the settlement of Jesús del Valle – Valle de los Incas, a rural zone within the agricultural district of Tambogrande. The area produces fruits for export and lies in the province of Piura, in the region of the same name, situated more than three hours from the city of Chiclayo, the capital of the Lambayeque region. Since she got married, Julia has worked raising and selling animals. She raises small animals such as poultry and sheep in enclosures located near her home. Once the animals have reached a good stage of development, she offers them for sale to traders who regularly frequent the area where she lives. In addition, she also makes and sells chicha (a typical beverage of the region, made from a base of corn flour) in her home. With the income she receives from this work, she helps her husband, who is a farmer, with the family's expenses. She would like to improve the nutrition of her animals so that she can obtain a higher income when she sells them. To achieve her objective, she plans to buy balanced animal feed, and for this reason she has requested a loan for the first time from Edpyme Alternativa, in the amount of 800 Peruvian new soles. Julia is a cheerful and responsible woman. Her greatest desire is to keep working to help her husband and provide her children with a better quality of life. In the area where she lives, her neighbors and others who know her consider her a steady and trustworthy woman.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying balanced feed to improve the nutrition of the small animals she raises for sale

loans.name: Gladys

texts.es:
Gladys es una madre de familia de 39 años de edad que vive junto a su esposo y a sus cuatro hijos en el caserío San Martín, una zona rural del distrito agrícola de Tambogrande,  zona productora de frutas para exportación que se encuentra ubicada en la provincia de Piura, en la región del mismo nombre, situada a mas de tres horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza y cosméticos por catálogo, ella cuenta con un grupo de clientes que le compran sus productos con frecuencia, mientras más pedidos le realizan obtiene mas puntos de parte de la empresa que le provee los productos y por consiguiente obtiene mayores ganancias. Por este motivo siempre se esfuerza por obtener cada vez mas clientes.

Adicionalmente posee un terreno en el cual tiene instalado un cultivo de mango y limón, el limón es cosechado semanalmente y el mango es cosechado una vez por año, los productos que cosecha los vende a las plantas procesadoras de la zona. Con estos negocios apoya a su esposo en el sostenimiento de la economía familiar.

Gladys desea contar con un capital estable para adquirir mas productos y contar con un stock fijo de cosméticos que permita a sus clientes adquirir los productos que necesitan rápidamente y no esperar hasta fin de mes, que es cuando le entregan los pedidos. Por ello ha solicitado a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 600 nuevos soles que le ayuden a conseguir su meta.

Gladys es una persona tranquila y bastante trabajadora, su mayor anhelo es hacer crecer su negocio para poder apoyar a su familia. En la zona donde vive ella es muy conocida y estimada por sus vecinos.
texts.en:
Martín, a rural area of the agricultural district of Tambogrande, known as a fruit for export producing zone, located in Piura province, Piura region, over three hours from the city of Chiclayo, Lambayeque region’s capital. She sells catalogue cosmetics and beauty products. She has a group of regular customers that buy her products frequently. The more orders they place the more points she gets from the firm that provides the products and therefore more profits. For this reason, she always does her best to acquire more and more customers every time. In addition she has a field where she grows mangoes and lemons. The lemons are harvested weekly and the mango is harvested once a year. She sells the products she harvests to local processing plants. These businesses help her husband support the family. Gladys would like to be able to count on stable capital to buy more products to have stock of cosmetics available so that her customers can buy the products they need quickly and not have to wait until the end of the month which is when she gets her orders. For this reason, she has asked Edpyme Alternativa for a 600 new sol loan to reach her goal. Gladys is a calm, very hard working person. Her greatest wish is to see her business grow and to be able to help support her family. Where she lives she is very well known and liked by her neighbors.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cosmetics.

loans.name: María Beatriz

texts.es:
La Señora. María Beatriz C. es socia del banco comunal Reina de la Nube, vive en  la ciudad de Cuenca,  esta ciudad es conocida por sus bellas iglesias, su centro histórico, es una ciudad muy rica en cultura y fue nombrada como patrimonio cultural de la humanidad en diciembre de 1999.

Doña María tiene de 35 años, es divorciada  y tiene 3 hijos de 20, 18 y 13 años de edad, sus dos primeras hijas son casadas y viven de manera independiente, su último hijo estudia en un colegio de la ciudad, no tiene casa propia por lo que vive arrendando.

La Señora. María se dedica a la venta de productos Avon hace 6 meses,  también vende ropa por catalogo hace 3 meses, ella recién está empezando con sus negocios y espera seguir creciendo en ellos.

Es nuestra socia hace 8 años y los créditos le han servido mucho en su hogar, su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de ropa y cosméticos para incrementar sus productos, su meta es  llegar a tener un capital propio de trabajo.
texts.en:
Sra. María Beatriz C. is a member of the Communal Bank “Reina de la Nube” (Queen of the Cloud). She lives in city of Cuenca, which is known for its beautiful churches and historical center. Being a city that is rich in culture, Cuenca was named a World Heritage Site in December 1999.

Doña María is 35 years old, divorced, and has three children (ages 20, 18, and 13). Her two older children are married and live independently. The youngest child is a student who attends high school in the city. She does not have a house of her own, so she lives in a rental property.

Sra. María has been selling Avon products for six months. She also has been selling clothing by catalog for three months. María recently started these businesses and hopes to continue growing them.

She has been a member of her Communal Bank for eight years and the loans have been a great help to her household. Her new loan will be invested in clothing and cosmetics to increase her inventory of products. Her goal is to accumulate her own operating capital.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase clothing & Avon cosmetics

loans.name: Mariana De Jesús

texts.es:
La Señora. Mariana de Jesús Z. es socia del banco comunal Reina de la Nube, vive en la comunidad de Paccha, la agricultura y ganadería son las ocupaciones tradicionales de los habitantes de Paccha, su producción solo abastece para el autoconsumo. La mayor parte de la población se traslada a la ciudad de Cuenca en busca de trabajo.

La Señora. Mariana de Jesús es muy joven con apenas 25 años, es madre soltera y tiene 3 hijos  de 9, 8 y 2 años de edad, sus dos primeros hijos estudian en la escuela, no tiene casa propia por lo que vive en un cuarto que le han prestado por el cuidado de un terreno.
 
Doña Mariana trabaja como empleada domestica hace 6 meses, en el cual labora de domingo a domingo.

Este es el tercer crédito que realiza en la fundación Espoir y  lo va a invertir en la compra de pollos para dedicarse también a este negocio.

Su sueño es algún día tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Mrs. Mariana de Jesús Z. is a member of the Reina de la Nube (Queen of the Cloud) communal bank. She lives in Paccha. Its residents are mostly farmers and cattlemen. They only produce enough for their own consumption. Most of the population goes to the city of Cuenca in search of work. Mrs. Mariana de Jesús is very young, she’s only 25. She’s a single mother of three children who are 9, 8, and 2 years of age. The two oldest are in school. She doesn’t own her home but lives in a room that is leant to her in exchange for her looking after a lot. Mariana has been employed as a domestic employee for the last 6 months; she works from Sunday to Sunday. This is the third loan she has had with Fundación Espoir. She will use it to buy chickens so that she can go into this business too. Her dream is to own her own house someday.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy chickens.

loans.name: Hilda

texts.es:
Hilda tiene 28 años de edad, es casada y vive junto a su esposo en el anexo Las Delicias del caserío Arbolsol, una zona rural del distrito de Mórrope, un distrito conformado por varios centros poblados considerados como zonas rurales, pertenece a la provincia de Lambayeque y se encuentra ubicado a mas de una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a la crianza y comercialización de ovejas, ella cría ovejas en diversos ambientes cercanos a su domicilio, las alimenta con pastos naturales y cuando estas ya han alcanzado un buen nivel de desarrollo las ofrece en venta a los negociantes que siempre visitan la zona en donde vive. Esta actividad le permite ayudar a su esposo, que es agricultor en el sostenimiento de la economía de su familia. 

Hilda desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de mas animales para criarlos y venderlos, por este motivo ha solicitado a Nuestra Institución un crédito de 500 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.

Hilda es una mujer tranquila y responsable, su tiempo transcurre en la realización de sus labores domésticas y en ayudar a su esposo con las labores agricolas. En la zona donde vive sus vecinos y conocidos le consideran una mujer tranquila y responsable.
texts.en:
Hilda, 28, is married and lives with her husband in Las Delicias, an annex of Arbolsol, a rural zone of Mórrope district which is made up of various rural population centers and is part of Lambayeque province and is located over an hour away from the city of Chiclayo. She raises sheep in several plots near her house for sale. Se feeds them natural grasses and when they grow to a good developmental stage she sells them to merchants who frequent the area where she lives. This activity allows her to help her husband, who is a farmer, to support the family. Hilda wants to expand her business buying more animals to raise and sell. For this reason she has asked Our Institution for a 500 new sol loan to help her reach her goal. Hilda is a very calm and responsible woman. Her time is taken up in her domestic chores and in helping her husband with the farming. In the area where she lives her neighbors and acquaintances consider her to be a levelheaded, responsible woman.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sheep.

loans.name: Janneth Isabel

texts.es:
La Señora Janneth Isabel R. es socia del banco comunal Reina de la Nube, vive en la  ciudad de Cuenca,  esta ciudad es conocida por sus bellas iglesias, su centro histórico, es una ciudad muy rica en cultura y fue nombrada  patrimonio cultural de la humanidad en diciembre de 1999.

Doña Janneth es comisionista de ventas, actividad que la realiza hace un año y medio, vende diferentes marcas de cosméticos, labora 6 horas al día de lunes a sábado el resto del tiempo se dedica a su familia.

La Señora. Janneth tiene 26 años, es casada y tiene un hijo de 2 años y medio, su esposo es de profesión mecánico, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven arrendando.

Este es el segundo crédito que realiza en la fundación, fue invitada por una compañera a formar parte de este grupo de mujeres luchadoras, su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de cosméticos para crecer en su negocio.

Su meta es llegar a tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Janneth Isabel R. is a member of the communal bank Reina de la Nube. She lives in the city of Cuenca, which is known for its beautiful churches, historic center and is a city very rich in culture. It was named a cultural heritage site in December of 1999. Janneth is a sales agent and has been for the past year and a half. She sells different brands of cosmetics and works 6 hours a day Monday through Saturday. The rest of her days she dedicates to her family. Janneth is 26 years old and is married with a son who is two and half. Her husband is a mechanic. They don't own their house but rent. This is the second loan she has requested from the foundation. She was invited by a friend to become a member of this group of women fighters. This new loan she is going to invest by buying cosmetics to grow her business. Her goal is to own her own home.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Fanning, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy lipsticks, creams, eye shadows, perfumes and general cosmetics.

loans.name: Wilder

texts.es:
Wilder tiene 34 años de edad, es soltero y vive junto a sus padres en el anexo Santa Rosa del caserío Lagunas, una zona rural del distrito de Mórrope, este distrito se caracteriza por tener a la mayor parte de su población situada en zonas rurales que distan mucho entre si. Pertenece a la provincia de Lambayeque y se encuentra ubicada a mas de una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a la venta de productos de primera necesidad y abarrotes en una bodega – tienda situada en su domicilio desde hace tres años. Ella ofrece a sus clientes todo tipo de artículos de uso diario por los cuales tendrían que movilizarse hasta el pueblo de Mórrope para adquirirlos. El negocio goza de buena acogida ya que ella siempre trata de brindar un buen trato y productos de calidad a sus clientes. Con los ingresos que percibe de esta actividad ayuda a sus padres con el sostenimiento de la economia de su familia.

Wilder desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de mas productos de modo que pueda satiafacer la demanda de sus clientes y percibir mayores ganancias. Para lograr su objetivo se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.

Wilder es una persona tranquila y responsable. En la zona donde vive sus vecinos y conocidos le consideran una persona tranquila y responsable.
texts.en:
Wilder is 34 years old, single, and lives with his parents in the annex Santa Rosa of the village of Lagunas, a rural area in the district of Mórrope. This district is characterized by having the majority of the population living in rural areas with a lot of distance in between them. It belongs to the province of Lambayeque and is located more than an hour from the city of Chiclayo. He works selling basic necessities and groceries in a store that has been located in his house for the past three years. He offers his customers all types of goods for daily use, which he had to move from the town of Mórrope where he purchased them. The business gets a lot of business and Wilder always tries to offer a good deals and quality products to his customers. With the income he receives from this business he helps his parents support the family financially. Wilder wants to help his business grow by buying more products so he can meet the demand of his clients and receive greater profits. To accomplish his goal he has seen the need to request a loan of 1000 nuevos soles from Edpyme Alternativa. Wilder is a very calm and responsible person. In the area where he lives, his neighbors and acquaintances consider him a calm and responsible person.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Fanning, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy basic necessities and groceries to expand the store installed in his house.

loans.name: Maria Elcira

texts.es:
María Elcira tiene 49 años de edad, es separada y vive junto a sus dos hijos en el sector Nueve de Octubre, una zona urbano marginal situada en los alrededores de la ciudad de Chiclayo, una de las ciudades – eje del comercio en el norte. Es bastante conocida por su movimiento comercial y de transporte.

Se dedica desde hace cinco años a la venta de cerveza en su domicilio. Ella vende esta bebida a sus vecinos los cuales la consumen preferentemente los fines de semana, debido al tiempo que lleva laborando en esta actividad su negocio se ha vuelto conocido y cuenta con una clientela estable. Los ingresos que ella percibe de esta actividad los utiliza en el sostenimiento de su familia.

Debido a la gran acogida con la que cuenta su negocio ella ha pensado ampliar su nivel de ventas adquiriendo mas cerveza, para lograr su objetivo ha creído conveniente solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles.

María Elcira es una mujer luchadora y trabajadora. Su mayor anhelo es seguir creciendo como empresaria para poder brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida. En la zona sus vecinos y conocidos la quieren y estiman mucho.
texts.en:
María Elcira is 49 years old. She is separated, and she lives with her two children in the Nueve de Octubre neighborhood. It is a marginally urban area on the outskirts of the city of Chiclayo, which is one of the pivotal commercial cities in the north. It is well-known for its commercial movement and for transportation. She has been selling beer in her house for five years. She sells this drink to her neighbors, who consume it preferably on the week-ends. Due to the time that she has spent working in her business, she has become well-known and has a stable customer base. She uses the income that she gets from this activity to support her family. Because her business is so well received, she plans on increasing her level of sales by getting more beer. To achieve this objective she believes it is advisable to request, for the first time, a loan for 1,500 soles from Edpyme Alternativa. María Elcira is a tenacious and hard-working woman. Her greatest desire is to continue growing as a businesswoman in order to be able to give her family a better quality of life. Her neighbors and acquaintances in the area like her and hold her in high esteem.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy beer to expand her sales business in her house

loans.name: Nasreen's Group

texts.en:
Nasreen lives in a historic city of Pakistan called Lahore.  She is 36 years old and has given birth to three sons and two daughters. All of them are getting their education. Her husband has a business selling ready-made garments. He takes orders from different ready-made garment shops and supplies the order by purchasing the clothing from factories. 

Nasreen herself is a seamstress, and she works full time. She gets orders from her neighborhood customers and sews beautifully designed clothes to earn a supplementary income for the family. 

Nasreen has applied for a loan for her husband who wants to buy a large quantity of ready-made garments to fill larger orders on time. Her husband is of the view that by taking larger orders he can earn more profits because there are better profit margins when dealing with big parties. Nasreen is hopeful that her husband will be able to earn big profits by investing money in his business.

She is a regular loan user of Asasah. She has maintained a good credit record in her previous two years of borrowing. Now she is on her third loan.

loans.use: Purchase ready-made garments for resale

loans.name: Zarina's Group

texts.en:
Zarina lives in a big city in Pakistan called Lahore. Lahore is the second largest city in Pakistan and the capital of Punjab province. She is a 41-year-old lady who has been living in Lahore with her family for the last 17 years. She is the mother of four sons. Her eldest son left his education after completing 12th standard and started to work to support the family financially. He is involved in the business of selling cooking oil.

Zarina is a widow. She supports her family by doing sewing work for her neighborhood customers. Her other income source is rental payments which she receives by renting out her upper storey. Her remaining sons are studying in 12th, 8th and 5th grades respectively. 

Zarina has a great desire for the better future for her children and wants her eldest son to establish his business. That’s why she has applied for a loan from Asasah for him. With the loan amount, he will buy more cooking oil for his shop which will increase his chances of making more income. 

Zarina is very much hopeful that her son will become a successful businessman one day and that day is not too far off.  She is a second year borrower of Asasah. Her previous loan record is very good and she has proved to be a very responsible client.

loans.use: Purchase cooking oil for resale

loans.name: Nazia's Group

texts.en:
Nazia is a housewife. She has been living in a historic city of Pakistan called Lahore for the past four years in a two-room brick house. She is thirty years old and married to M. A. who works in a newspaper company named “Dawn” as a newspaper seller. She has two children: a three-year-old son named M. Farooq and a two-year-old daughter named Wajeeha. 

Nazia is very supportive by nature. She owns and operates a clothes-selling business to share the financial burden with her husband. She buys clothes from the famous markets of Lahore called “Ichra & Anarkali” and sells the goods to different shops at her nearby market and to her community as well. She earns approximately 8-10 thousand PKRs every month. 
 
She has applied for a loan from Asasah for her clothes business. With the loan amount she will buy clothes of different varieties and designed in large quantity and give expansion to her business. She is a new loan user of Asasah. She is hopeful that it will be a profitable experience for her.

loans.use: Purchase clothes for resale

loans.name: Nazia

texts.en:
Nazia comes from a historic city of Pakistan called Lahore. She lives in a four-room brick house with her family in the area called Yadgar. She moved here after her marriage with S. M. two years ago. She is 31 years old, a very enthusiastic lady who has an infant child, a baby girl named Rosemary. As a housewife she is doing a great job and is playing her part as a mother and a wife very well.

Her husband is a blacksmith. He runs a shop in the market where he makes iron rods and iron-made items such as doors and windows for his customers. He has been doing this work since his youth. He learned this art from his father who was a famous blacksmith of his time.  

Nazia has applied for a loan from Asasah for her husband. With the loan amount her husband will buy iron in larger quantity because he has got a large order to fill. Nazia is confident that her husband will be able to fill the order with the loan investment and her family will be able to enjoy better living conditions. She is a new loan applicant. She is hopeful that it will be a good experience for her and her family.

loans.use: Purchase iron to fill a large order on time

loans.name: Akylbek

texts.en:
Akylbek  B. is 41-year-old ambitious  entrepreneur who lives in Osh city, in the south of Kyrgyzstan. He is married and has four daughters; the youngest one is three years old. Akylbek has a very united family, where all members help and support each other.

In 1995, in order to find a way to earn a living to support his family, Akylbek decided to begin his business. Experience showed that he was most successful in the trade sector. He engaged in garment-reselling with a starting capital of 8,000 KGS. Due to Akylbek’s strong efforts and tireless endeavor, he managed to enlarge his assortment of goods with various high-quality products.  In 2008, Akylbek took a loan from Bai Tushum and Partners to set up a second sales point at the local market for selling children's and adults’ shoes. 

Unfortunately, Akylbek lost his business, which was burned to ashes during violent clashes, caused by deposed political regime which broke out in the city of Osh in June 2010.   But Akylbek, being a very optimistic and hard-working person, didn’t give up and is doing his best to rise from the ruins.  

Akylbek is applying for a loan of 135,000 KGS to resume his lost business and continue his activities. It will allow him further development of his household and business. Akylbek believes that mutual understanding and friendship always lead to prosperity and well-being. 

Bai-Tushum and Partners uses Kiva funding to target the especially vulnerable population. Bai-Tushum and Partners is one of the leading Microfinance Institutions in Kyrgyzstan. As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of microfinance services in rural and urban areas that lead to increased employment and meet the interests of its clients and investors.

loans.use: to purchase shoes

loans.name: Zahida's Group

texts.en:
Zahida is a resident of Lahore, the second largest city in Pakistan and known for its history and culture. 
She is 35 years old lives in a three-roomed brick house with her family. She has converted her house into a home with her great management qualities.  
Zahida is the mother of a 12 year old son who had to start a business at a very early age and couldn’t get an education. He sells purses and men's wallets. Her husband is illiterate and works in a vegetable market as a vegetable seller. Zahida supports her family by operating a PCO (Public calling office where people make a call and pay the call charges) at her home. She has dedicated a room and converted it to a PCO. Her business is currently going well. 

Zahida has applied for a loan from Asasah for her husband who wants to buy some seasonal vegetables for his business. She hopes that her husband’s business will improve and his income will be increased. She is a regular loan user of Asasahand; this is her fifth loan cycle. She has proven herself as a responsible client who never misses a single meeting and timely pays her installments. 

Note: "In this photo, Zahida is showing the phone sets in her PCO".

loans.use: Purchase seasonal vegetables for selling.

loans.name: Razia's Group

texts.en:
Razia lives in Lahore, a historic city in Pakistan and the capital city of Punjab province. She has recently moved to the area named Yadgar with her husband and family. She is a fifty one year old lady who spends most of her time at her home and does her household responsibilities. She has three children. All of her children are illiterate and involved in different businesses. Her eldest son is an electrician. The middle one works in a motor-workshop and the youngest prepares embroidered dresses on order. Her husband is 60 years old and doesn’t do any work. 

Razia has applied for a loan on behalf of her eldest son for his electric work. With the loan amount he will buy the latest repairing tools to provide better electricity repairing facilities for his customers. Razia is hopeful that this investment will prove beneficial for her son and that he will be able to generate a good income from it. She has a plan to marry him off next year so he will become a family man and spends his life happily. She is a regular loan user of Asasah and is in 3rd loan cycle.

loans.use: Purchase of the latest electric repairing tools.

loans.name: Nazia's Group

texts.en:
Nazia is a 31 year old lady who has spent most of her life in Lahore. Lahore is located in the Punjab province of Pakistan and is the second largest city of the country. 

Nazia lives in a single-room brick house with her husband and three children, two daughters and a son. Their first two children are getting their education and the youngest daughter has not started to attend school yet. Nazia is a housewife who spends her time with her children in raising them and doing her household responsibilities. She has applied for a loan from Asasah for her husband, who runs a grocery shop in the nearby market. He has six years of working experience in this field. He serves his customers with groceries. People come to him for buying groceries because of his quality items and, most importantly, his reasonable prices. With the loan amount he will put more groceries in his shop and increase his sales. 

Nazia hopes that her family will be able to enjoy better facilities of life with the help of an increased income from her husband's business. Nazia is a regular loan user of Asasah. She is in her 3rd loan cycle.

loans.use: To purchase groceries for grocery shop.

loans.name: Mahabat

texts.en:
Mahabat E. is from Talas, which is situated in the north of Kyrgyzstan. She is 29, married, with three children.  Mahabat and her husband are expecting a baby this year. 

 Mahabat is a young and entrepreneurial woman.  She finished secondary school, but could not continue her studies. Seven years ago, in order to support her family, Mahabat decided to begin her business activities in cattle breeding. Mahabat started this business with a capital of 5,000 KGS.  Today she has twenty milch cows, whose milk she sells to the local dairy factory, earning about 14,000 KGS a month.  She has also a plot of land where she grows potatoes and perennial herbs, which serve as concentrate of forage for her cattle and ensure a high quality of milk yield.  

Mahabat wants to use this loan of 120,000 KGS to buy more milch cows in order to increase her sales of milk and also acquire new customers. With the revenues from this loan, Mahabat plans to build a barn for her cattle to provide good conditions of cattle maintenance. Mahabat’s young family is learning to overcome difficulties and resolve problems and she is full of energy for the many achievements on her way.

Bai-Tushum and Partners uses Kiva funding to target the especially vulnerable population. Bai-Tushum and Partners is one of the leading Microfinance Institutions in Kyrgyzstan. As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of microfinance services in rural and urban areas that lead to increased employment and meet the interests of its clients and investors.

loans.use: to purchase dairy cattle

loans.name: Irshad's Group

texts.en:
Irshad is a resident of Lahore, the second largest city in Pakistan and well known for its history and the hospitality of its people. Irshad is 53 years old and cannot work at this old age, but stays at home and carries out her responsibilities of a housewife well. She has given birth to two daughters and two sons. Both sons left their education after completing 10th standard because their family needed their financial support. Both have a motor workshop where they repair, specifically, motorbikes. Her elder daughter got her education up to the 14th standard and teaches in a private school as a teacher. Her youngest daughter is studying in the 10th standard. 

Irshad's husband has a construction supplies business, but at the old age of 60 he can’t work full-time. Irshad has applied for a loan from Asasah for her sons who want to start a motorbike spare-parts sales business. With the loan amount, they will buy spare parts for motorbikes which they will sell from their motor workshop. They have been running their motor workshop for over five years and Irshad is hopeful that this investment will prove beneficial for their business. This is the 1st time that Irshad has applied for a loan to any MFI and she hopes that it will be a long term relationship between her and Asasah.

loans.use: To purchase motorbikes spare-parts for selling.

loans.name: Bashiran's Group

texts.en:
Bashiran has been living in Lahore for the past 15 years with her husband and two children. Lahore is the second largest city in Pakistan and famous for its gardens. Bashiran is a 47 year old housewife who has raised her children with great care and responsibility, but she couldn’t educate her son due to financial problems. Her son works in an auto workshop and her daughter is studying in the 5th standard because she started studying late. 
Bashiran's husband has a business of scrap which he started after shifting to Lahore city. He buys rough and rotted items, such as wasted papers, wooden cupboards and book racks, etc., and re-sells them to factories at a good profit.  

Bashiran has applied for a loan from Asasah to upgrade her husband’s business. With the loan amount he will buy scrap in bulk and increase his profit. 
Bashiran is hopeful that this investment will bring positive changes to her family’s financial conditions and improve the family's standard of living. She is in her 3rd loan cycle. She is a regular loan user of Asasah and has built a good credit standing. She has never missed a meeting.

loans.use: To purchase scrap for scrap business.

loans.name: Fridah

texts.en: Fridah N. is 20 years old and lives in the town of Bulenga in the Kampala region of Uganda. She is single and has a child, who is not currently in school. Fridah has a business of pig production, which she has had for less than one year. To help expand her business, Fridah has requested a loan of 100,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more pigs. With the help of the loan from BRAC, Fridah hopes to generate greater profits and sometimes buy food. In the future, Fridah hopes to go back to school. Fridah is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by allowing her to learn how to read and how to save. Note to lenders: BRAC Uganda has recently begun posting a new loan product to Kiva which funds young entrepreneurs in BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. This Kiva borrower is receiving a new ELA loan. The ELA program first provides disadvantaged adolescents, usually girls who are out of school, with livelihood training and financial literacy skills. Afterward, ELA participants can receive microfinance loans to expand their small businesses. These loans offer adolescents a unique chance to access finance at a young age and improve their prospects for the future, and target a segment of the population not typically served by traditional microfinance. Kiva is privileged to partner with BRAC Uganda in posting these new loans, and give Kiva lenders the opportunity to fund deserving young entrepreneurs and support a promising new sector in microfinance.

loans.use: To buy more pigs

loans.name: Sharifah

texts.en: Sharifah N. is 19 years old and lives in the town of Bulenga in the Kampala region of Uganda. She is single and has no children. Sharifah has a business of selling vegetables, which she has had for less than one year. Sharifah also has a business selling charcoal. To help expand her business, Sharifah has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more charcoal and vegetables. With the help of the loan from BRAC, Sharifah hopes to generate greater profits and sometimes buy food at home. In the future, Sharifah hopes to own a beauty salon. Sharifah is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by teaching her the skills of getting a job and how to read. Note to lenders: BRAC Uganda has recently begun posting a new loan product to Kiva which funds young entrepreneurs in BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. This Kiva borrower is receiving a new ELA loan. The ELA program first provides disadvantaged adolescents, usually girls who are out of school, with livelihood training and financial literacy skills. Afterward, ELA participants can receive microfinance loans to expand their small businesses. These loans offer adolescents a unique chance to access finance at a young age and improve their prospects for the future, and target a segment of the population not typically served by traditional microfinance. Kiva is privileged to partner with BRAC Uganda in posting these new loans, and give Kiva lenders the opportunity to fund deserving young entrepreneurs and support a promising new sector in microfinance.

loans.use: To buy more vegetables and more charcaol

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase clothes for retail

loans.name: Josephen

texts.en:
Josephen is 36 years old. She is a married mother of six children aged between 7 and 22. All the children attend school. She has been practicing mixed farming for 18 years in Kisii town, western Kenya. Her farm produces maize, beans, tea leaves, millet, bananas, coffee, tomatoes, vegetables and milk, which she sells to the Kenya Tea Development Authority, the Coffee Board of Kenya and at the local market. 
 
Josephen has requested this loan from Juhudi Kilimo of 70,000 Kenyan Shillings to expand her cereal business and vegetable farming.  She says that with the profits from this loan, she will manage to educate her children and feed and clothe the family well. 

In five years time, she hopes to add two more quality dairy cows and be the main supplier in the locality. The challenges she faces in business are unstable prices, especially for vegetables, the high cost of pesticides, a lack of proper spraying gear and fluctuating weather patterns, which affect her crop production. 

She appreciates how far Juhudi has brought them and prays to manage her loan repayment well.

loans.use: To expand her cereal business and vegetable farming

loans.name: Ciciliah

texts.en:
Ciciliah has a mixed farm in Kisii town, Western Kenya, which produces maize, beans, millet, vegetables, bananas, coffee, tea leaves, and milk.  She sells her products to Kenya Tea Development Authority, the Coffee board of Kenya, and at the local market. She also runs a kiosk as her other source of income.

Ciciliah is 40 years old, married and a mother of five children who are all adults. Three of the children attend school. 

Ciciliah recently completed her previous loan from Juhudi Kilimo and has requested this loan of 70,000 Kenyan Shillings to expand her poultry farming and lease more land for vegetable farming. She hopes her business will do well and that she will be able to educate her children through college level and provide for their basic needs with the extra income from this loan.

In five years' time, she plans to expand her farming business and venture into new markets and start a second-hand clothes business. She however faces the challenges of transportation and fluctuating weather patterns that affect her production.  She appreciates and appeals to Juhudi to consider giving them the interest on savings instead of adding to shares.

loans.use: To expand her poultry farming and lease more land for vegetable farming

loans.name: Anna

texts.en:
Anna is 40 years old, a widowed mother of three children who are now aged between 25 and 14. One of her children attends school.  She has been practising mixed farming for the last 20 years in the town of Kisii, Western Kenya. Her farm produces maize, tea leaves, milk, beans, sweet potatoes, millet, and bananas which she sells to Kenya Tea Development Authority and the local market. She also operates a kiosk in the same area.

Anna has requested her second loan from Juhudi Kilimo of 30,000 Kenyan Shillings to lease more land for farming. The proceeds from this loan will enable her to educate her children and improve her living standards. 

In five years' time, she plans to venture into new markets and sell more products to outside markets. Her biggest challenges are pests and diseases that affect her crops. Bad debtors also affect her business and lack of capital for expansion. 

She appreciates the help and hopes for the partnership to continue into the future.

loans.use: To lease more land for farming

loans.name: Cheikh A.tidiane

texts.fr:
Monsieur Cheikh Ahmed Tidiane S. habite à Yoff Ngaparou. Il est âgé  de 64 ans. Il est marié et père de 7 enfants dont l’âge  varie entre 9 et 26 ans.
Monsieur S. a opté son choix sur l’activité de commerce pour pouvoir subvenir aux besoins de sa famille. Par conséquent il pratique la vente de gaz dans un local de son quartier depuis plus de 30ans. Auparavant  il a travaillé comme agent administratif à l’ONCAD entre 1983 et 1990.
Monsieur S. est sociétaire de la caisse de l’UIMCEC à Yoff depuis mai 2003. Il sollicite un crédit de 300 000 frs destiné a l’achat de bouteilles  de gaz  dans le but de renforcer sa boutique et d’accroitre  le niveau de ses bénéfices. Son souhait est d’améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille et aussi de leur donner l’occasion d’hériter  en lui une activité productive.
texts.en:
Mr. Cheikh Ahmed Tidiane S. lives in Yoff Ngaparou. He is 64 years old, married and the father of 7 children aged between 9 and 26. Mr. S. chose to become a trader as a way to meet his family's needs. He has been selling gas in his neighborhood for over 30 years. Previously, he was an administrative worker at ONCAD, from 1983 to 1990. A member of the UIMCEC savings bank in Yoff since May 2003, he is asking for a loan of 300,000 francs to buy bottles of gas in order to increase supply in his store and to make a higher level of profit. His wish is to improve his family's living conditions and also to give them the opportunity to inherit a successful business activity from him.

Translated from French by Sarah Puchner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase working capital

loans.name: Ngone

texts.fr:
Madame Ngoné S. est une jeune femme mariée de 26 ans. Elle habite dans le quartier de Mbenguene à Yoff. Elle est mère de 2 enfants dont l’âge varie entre 3 et 10ans. 
Pour madame S. les conseils de son mari lui ont permis de choisir l’activité de commerce  dans l’espoir de réaliser des bénéfices  afin de pouvoir réaliser son vœu qui est d’aider son mari. Elle s’active depuis plus de 3 mois dans la vente de glace et de jus car elle dispose d’un frigo. Madame S. vend aussi des chaussures.
Elle est membre de la caisse de Yoff depuis mai 2010. Elle sollicite un crédit de 50 000 frs prévu pour l’achat de sucre , de chaussures et de sacs d’oseille destinés a la vente. Elle souhaite renforcer son fond de commerce et améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Mrs. Ngoné S. is a young, 26-year-old married woman. She lives in the neighborhood of Mbenguene, in Yoff. She is the mother of two children, ages 3 and 10. Relying on her husband’s advice, Mrs. S. engaged in commerce in hopes of accumulating profits that would allow her to fulfill her goal of helping her husband. For over three months, she has been selling ice and juice, having a refrigerator at her disposal. She also sells shoes. Mrs. S. has been a member of the Yoff credit union since May 2010. She is requesting a loan of 50,000 francs to buy sugar, shoes and bags of sorrel for resale. She wants to strengthen her working capital and improve her family’s living conditions.

Translated from French by Nathalie Pelletier, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To strengthen her working capital

loans.name: Faithful Women Group

texts.en:
Christina G., who is holding the sign, is the leader of this group of five borrowers called 'Faithful Women'. Christina is 46 years old, married, and has two children, 24 and 27 years old. She was not able to attend school due to poverty. She cares for nine siblings.

For 31 years, she has been selling plantains, potatoes, and bananas in New Georgia Market on the outskirts of Monrovia, Liberia. She plans to use her 4,000 Liberian Dollar portion of this 20,000 Liberian Dollar group loan to buy more plantains, potatoes, and bananas. She describes herself as jovial.

Her dream is to grow her business and build a house.

loans.use: To buy more plantains, potatoes, and bananas

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more children's clothes and body lotion

loans.name: Thioro

texts.fr:
Madame Thioro D. est une femme de 42 ans. Elle habite dans le quartier  Tonghor a Yoff. Elle est mariée et mère de 2 enfants âgés  respectivement de 12 et 18 ans. 
Madame D. exerce l’activité de commerce  qu’elle a choisi par passion depuis 25 ans car elle ne voulait pas être  marginalisée compte tenu de son handicap. Ainsi depuis lors elle s’adonne à la vente de  glace et de jus mais aussi elle pratique la coiffure chez elle depuis plus de 30ans. Ce qui l’intéresse le plus dans son activité c’est  le fait qu’elle parvienne a assurer son insertion dans le milieu social et a éviter  l’oisiveté. 
Elle est sociétaire de la caisse de Yoff depuis juin 2005 et a déjà  bénéficié de 2 crédits antérieurs. Elle sollicite un crédit de 500 000 frs montant  avec lequel elle envisage d’acheter un deuxième frigo. Le reste du financement lui permettra de faire une petite opération Tabaski.
Madame D. souhaite améliorer le cadre de vie de sa famille par l’accroissement de son chiffre d’affaire et de ses bénéfices surtout durant la  période  des fêtes. Son objectif est de satisfaire la demande de plus en plus croissante de sa clientèle.
texts.en:
Mrs. Thioro D. is a 42-year-old woman who lives in the neighborhood of Tonghor, in Yoff. She is married with two children, aged 12 and 18. Mrs. D. is engaged in a commercial activity chosen out of a 25-year passion to avoid being marginalized due to her disability. Therefore, she has been selling ice and juice ever since, but she has also been working as a hairdresser from her home for over 30 years. What motivates her most about her work is being included in the social environment and avoiding idleness. She has been a member of the Yoff credit union since June 2005 and has been granted two previous loans. She is requesting a loan of 500,000 francs, which she will use to buy a second refrigerator. The remainder of the loan will allow her to hold a small Tabaski ceremony. Mrs. D. wishes to improve her family’s living conditions by increasing her sales and profits, especially during the holiday season. Her goal is to satisfy the increasing demand of her customers.

Translated from French by Nathalie Pelletier, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a refrigerator

loans.name: Faith Group

texts.en:
Sonnie J., who is holding the sign, is the leader of this group of five borrowers called Faith. Sonnie is 36 years old, married, and has five children who range from 20 to 8 years old. She was not able to attend school due to poverty. All of her children are attending school. For 3 years, she has been selling oil, salt, tomatoes, and peppers in New Georgia Market on the outskirts of Monrovia, Liberia.

She plans to use her 5,000 Liberian Dollar portion of this 25,000 Liberian Dollar group loan to buy more oil, salt, tomatoes, and peppers. She describes herself as determined. Her dream is to grow her business, build a house, and continue to educate her children.

loans.use: To buy more oil, salt, tomatoes and peppers

loans.name: Maty Laye

texts.fr:
Madame Maty Laye S. est une femme de 30ans qui habite à Yoff Layenne. Elle est mariée sans enfant. 
Madame S. évolue dans l’enseignement depuis 2001 dans une école primaire. 
Après la seconde elle a opté de faire une formation pour intégrer  l’enseignement  suite a une suggestion de son père. Son choix a toujours porté sur les élèves de Ci.
Elle est membre de la caisse de Yoff depuis mai 2009. Elle y a déjà  bénéficié d’un prêt antérieur. Elle sollicite un crédit de 200 000 frs dans le but d’assister et de  soutenir financièrement  une de ses sœurs qui serait en difficulté.
Son objectif est de stabiliser le cadre de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Mrs. Maty Laye S. is a 30 year old woman who lives in Yoff Layenne. She is married, but does not have any children. Mrs. S. has been a primary school teacher since 2001. After "la seconde" (first year of the Lycée, about middle of high school), she decided train as a teacher after her father suggested it. Her first choice has always been the students of the "cours d'initiation" (first year of school, equivalent to Grade 1). She has been a member of the Yoff bank since May 2009. She has already benefited from one loan. She is seeking a loan of 200,000 francs in order to support one of her sisters who is having financial difficulties. Mrs. S.'s goal is to stabilize her family life.

Translated from French by Eileen Jessop, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Social need

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more cartons of fish

loans.name: Aboukhasim

texts.fr:
Monsieur Aboukhasim Diène  habite à  Ndeugagne, un des quartiers du village de Yoff. Il est âgé  de 46 ans. Il est marié et père d’un enfant de 3 ans. 
Monsieur Diène  s’active dans le commerce  depuis  plusieurs années  à cause de son aspect lucratif. Depuis  1994 il gère une quincaillerie et s’adonne a la vente de  ciment, de fer, de béton, et de briques. Aussi il a une expérience  de plus de 30 ans dans la menuiserie et la maçonnerie. 
Il est sociétaire  de la caisse de Yoff depuis aout 2004 et y a déjà  bénéficié  de 3 prêts  antérieurs. Il sollicite un crédit  de 500 000 frs prévu pour  l’achat de ciment, de sable et de béton destinés a la vente.  En renforçant  son stock de commerce il souhaite augmenter ses revenus afin d’acquérir   un terrain  et mettre sa famille dans des conditions meilleures.
texts.en:
Mr. Aboukhasim Diène lives in Ndeugagne, one of the neighborhoods of the village of Yoff. He is 46 years old, married, and the father of 3 children. Mr. Diène has been in business for many years because it is profitable. He has managed a hardware store since 1994 and sells cement, iron, concrete and bricks. He also has over 30 years experience in carpentry and masonry. He has been a member of the Yoff bank since August 2004 and has already benefited from 3 previous loans. He is seeking a loan of 500,000 francs in order to buy cement, sand and concrete to sell. By building his inventory he hopes to increase his income so that he can buy some land and improve conditions for his family.

Translated from French by Eileen Jessop, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase working capital

loans.name: Blessed Hands Group

texts.en:
Kumba H., who is holding the sign, is the leader of this group of five borrowers called 'Blessed Hands'. Kumba is 40 years old, married, and has three children who range from 17 to 24 years old. She cares for one sibling. She was not able to attend school due to poverty. All of her children are attending school.

For 4 years, she has been selling slippers in Logan Town Market on the outskirts of Monrovia, Liberia. She plans to use her 7,000 Liberian Dollar portion of this 32,000 Liberian Dollar group loan to buy more slippers. She describes herself as determined.

Her dream is to grow her business, build a house, and continue to educate her children.

loans.use: To buy more slippers

loans.name: Adama

texts.fr:
Monsieur Adama T. est un habitant du quartier de Ngaparou à Yoff. Il est âgé  de 30 ans . Il est marié sans enfant. 
Après ses études primaires puisque n’ayant pas réussi dans sa carrière monsieur T. est devenu tailleur  par passion. Ainsi depuis 1996 il pratique la couture. Cependant depuis trois mois il est orienté dans le commerce de mercerie. Pour lui les aspects les plus intéressants  de son travail sont la confection de beaux habits et la  réalisation de profits. 
Il est membre  de la caisse  de Yoff depuis le mois de mai 2010. Il sollicite un crédit de 500 000 frs pour acheter  des fournitures pour les besoins de son atelier de  couture et de la mercerie.
Son objectif est d’accroitre ses bénéfices et d’améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille. Son rêve est d’acquérir dans le futur une grande boutique  de mercerie
texts.en:
Mr. Adama T. lives in the Ngaparou neighborhood in Yoff. He is 30 years old. He is married and has no children. After his elementary school education, and not having succeeded in his career, Mr. T. became a tailor because it was his passion. He has thus been making clothes since 1996. However, for the last three months, he has turned to opening a dry goods store. The most attractive aspects of his work are the construction of nice clothes and the realization of profits. He has been a member of the Yoff bank since May 2010. He is seeking a loan of 500,000 frs to buy supplies for his sewing workshop and dry goods store. His goal is to increase his profits and to improve his family’s living conditions. His dream is to one day open a large dry goods store.

Translated from French by Sherry W., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy dry goods

loans.name: Benetha Group

texts.en:
Benetha B., who is holding the sign, is the leader of this group of five borrowers called 'Benetha Group'. Benetha is 40 years old, single and has seven children who range from 22 to 4 years old. She was not able to attend school due to poverty. All of her children are attending school. She cares for one sibling.

For 10 years, Benetha has been selling oil, salt, tomatoes, beans, rice, and peppers in Sayon Town Market on Bushrod Island in Monrovia, Liberia. She plans to use her 10,000 Liberian Dollar portion of this 50,000 Liberian Dollar group loan to buy more oil, salt, tomatoes, beans, rice, and peppers. She describes herself as determined.

Her goal is to improve her business and continue to educate her children. In the photo that accompanies this profile, Samuel F. is inset because he was absent during the meeting.

loans.use: To buy more oil, salt, tomatoes, beans, rice, and peppers

loans.name: Happy People Group

texts.en:
Paul K., who is holding the sign, is the leader of this group of five borrowers called 'Happy People'. Paul is 39 years old, married, and has two children, 6 and 13 years old. He was only able to attend school through 10th grade due to lack of financial support. 

For 10 years, he has been operating a tailoring shop in Barnesville outside of Monrovia, Liberia. He plans to use his 10,000 Liberian Dollar portion of this 50,000 Liberian Dollar group loan to buy more cloth.

Paul describes himself as an earnest person. His goal is to grow his business and educate his children.

loans.use: To buy more cloth

loans.name: Lamine

texts.fr:
Monsieur Lamine M. est un jeune yoffois  de 23 ans qui habite dans le quartier de Ngaparou. C’est un célibataire qui n’a aucun enfant en charge. 
Monsieur M. a choisi l’activité de mécanicien par passion mais il est  aussi intéressé par l aspect lucratif de l’activité. En 2002 c’était sa seule préoccupation. Mais en 2005 il a commencé à pratiquer le commerce de pièces détachées. 
Il est sociétaire de la caisse de Yoff depuis juin 2009 mais n’a jamais bénéficié de crédit au sein de l’institution. Il sollicite un crédit de 300 000 frs en vue de renforcer le stock de pièces détachées qu’elle commercialise dans sa cantine. 
Son objectif visé est de mieux rentabiliser son activité et d’améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille. Son rêve  et de se procurer un grand magasin de pièces détachées dans l’avenir.
texts.en:
Mr. Lamine M. is a young 23-year old man from Yoff, who lives in the Ngaparou district. He is single and has no children in his care. Mr. M. chose his trade as a mechanic out of love for this activity but he is also interested by its lucrative nature. In 2002 this was his only occupation. But in 2005 he began trading in spare parts. He has been a shareholder-member of the savings institution in Yoff since June 2009 but has never taken out any loan from the institution. He is now requesting a loan of 300,000 francs to boost his stock of spare parts which he sells in his "canteen". His aim is to make his activity more profitable and to improve his family's living conditions. His dream for the future is to get a large spare parts shop.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of spare parts

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more oil, salt, tomatoes, beans, rice, and peppers

loans.name: Our Father #3 Group

texts.en:
Famata T., who is holding the sign, is the leader of this group of five borrowers called Our Father #3. Famata is 37 years old, married and has five children who range from 3 to 18 years old. She cares for four siblings.

She was not able to attend school due to poverty. All of her children are attending school.

For 12 years, she has been selling used clothes in the River View Community Market on the outskirts of Monrovia, Liberia.

She plans to use her 7,500-Liberian-Dollar portion of this 37,500-Liberian-Dollar group loan to buy more bags of used clothes. She describes herself as earnest.

Her goals are to improve her business, build a house and continue to educate her children.

loans.use: To buy more bags of used clothes

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is 44 years old. She is a married mother of six children who are now aged between 7 and 21. Four of the children attend school. She has been practicing mixed farming for over 20 years in Kisii town, western Kenya. Her farm produces maize, milk, bananas, pineapples, millet, tea leaves and beans, which she sells at both the Kenya Tea Development Authority and at the local market.

Grace has requested this second loan from Juhudi Kilimo of 45,000 Kenyan Shillings to expand her cereal business. She says that the extra income from this loan will enable her to continue educating her children and she will be able to provide enough milk and food for the family. 

In five years time, she plans to expand her cereal business and open at least one cereal store and also buy a posho mill.

Her major challenges have been a poor transport system and the fluctuating prices of cereals. She appreciates how far Juhudi has improved them.

loans.use: To expand her cereals business

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more cartons of milk, soap, toothpaste, candy, copybooks and sugar

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more cartons of pharmaceutical drugs (medicine).

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary has been operating her mixed farm for over thirty years in the town of Kisii in Western Kenya. Her farm produces maize, milk, beans, millet, vegetables and tea leaves, which she sells to the Kenya Tea Development Authority and the local market. She also operates a business selling both second-hand and new clothes. Mary is 52 years old. She is married and has been blessed with six children, all now adults. One of her children is currently attending school.

Mary has a good record with Juhudi Kilimo, after she successfully completed her previous loans. She has requested this loan of 90,000 Kenyan Shillings to purchase a dairy cow and expand her cereal business by increasing stock. She hopes to be able to provide for the basic needs of her family with the proceeds from this loan.
