In the future, she plans to start a big hardware store and to buy a transportation truck.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow and to expand her cereal business.

loans.name: Malick Sémou

texts.fr:
Monsieur Malick Sémou  D. est un habitant du village de Yoff. Il est marié et père de 7 enfants dont l’âge  varie entre 2 et 16 ans. Il est âgé d 36 ans. 
Monsieur D. est boulanger de métier. Il a choisi cette activité par passion. Mais parallèlement  il s’est  adonne à l’élevage  et au commerce de moutons. L’élevage  de moutons, il l’a hérité de sa grand-mère qui lui avait légué quelques  moutons. Ainsi il en a fait une activité secondaire.
Il est sociétaire de la caisse de Yoff  depuis mai 2010. Il sollicite un crédit de 250000 frs en vue d’acheter des moutons destinés a la vente. Il a aussi prévu d’étendre  son enclos  avec une partie du financement. La réalisation de profits supplémentaires lui permettra de mieux assister sa famille dans leurs besoins vitaux.
texts.en:
Mr. Malick Sémou D. is an inhabitant of the village of Yoff. He is married and the father of seven children aged between 2 and 16. He himself is 36 years old. Mr. D. is a baker. He chose this trade because he loves it. In addition, however, he raises and sells sheep. His sheep-raising is something he inherited from his grandmother who left him several sheep. So he made that his secondary business. He has been a member of the Yoff branch since May 2010. He is requesting a loan of 250,000 francs to buy sheep that he intends to re-sell. He also intends to expand his sheep pen with part of the loan. Any supplementary profit he makes will allow him to better support his family and provide for their basic needs.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of sheep for resale

loans.name: Abisiba

texts.en:
Abisiba is a farmer from Kisii town in Western Kenya. She has been operating her mixed farm for over thirty years. Her main products are maize, tea leaves, bananas, millet and beans, which she sells at the local Magena market, Kenya Tea Development Authority and to other retailers. She also runs a hotel business in the same area.
 
Abisiba is 54 years old. She is married and has been blessed with eight children, now aged between 13 and 38 years. Two of the children attend school.  

Abisiba has requested her second loan from Juhudi Kilimo, of 50,000 Kenyan Shillings to expand her cereal business. She says that the extra income from this loan will enable her to take her children to a better school and to provide for their basic needs. In the future, she intends to open up a big retail shop in her locality and, at the same time, expand her cereal store.

The challenges she faces in business are transport problems during the rainy season and unpredictable weather patterns affecting farm produce. She appreciates how far Juhudi has brought her and hopes that the partnership will continue.

loans.use: To expand her cereal business.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is 58 years old. She is a widowed mother of five children who are now between 20 and 35 years of age. Two of the children attend school. Alice has been operating and managing her mixed farm for the last 35 years in Kisii town, Western Kenya. She has four employees. Her farm produces coffee, tea, maize and sukumawiki (greens). She sells her coffee to Kenyenya machine and tea to Eberege factory in Kisii town.

Alice has requested this loan from Juhudi Kilimo of 30,000 Kenyan Shillings to purchase and insure a dairy cow. She says that this loan will enable her get enough milk for domestic consumption and sale. She hopes that in five years time, she will have expanded her farming activities and improved her income.

Her biggest challenge in farming has been lack of market for her vegetables. She is thankful to Juhudi for addressing the needs of the people.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Aliou

texts.fr:
Monsieur Aliou S. est un yoffois  de 48 ans qui habite a Dagoudane. Il est marié sans enfant.
Pour ne pas rester inactif monsieur S. a choisi l’activité de mareyeur pour gagner sa vie. Depuis plus de 20 ans il exerce cette activité qui l’intéresse  par son aspect lucratif. La particularité de monsieur S. par rapport a d’autres mareyeurs est qu’il a acquit une  clientèle fidèle, composée d’usines de la place a qui il fournit régulièrement  du poisson. Il est sociétaire  de la caisse de Yoff depuis janvier 2010. Il sollicite un crédit de 200 000 frs destiné à renforcer son fond de roulement afin d’accroitre la rentabilité de son activité dans l’espoir de mettre sur pied a  l’avenir une grande usine de mareyage.
texts.en:
Mrs. Maguette Gbaguidi, 41, lives in the Parcelles Assainies, a suburb of Dakar, not far from the village of Yoff. She is married and the mother of three children between 8 and 16 years of age. After leaving secretarial and office management school, Mrs. Gbaguidi has been working as a secretary in a school located in the Parcelles Assainies. She enjoys managing pupils and their paperwork. Besides that, however, she sells Alovera products. She is a member of the Yoff branch and is borrowing 500,000 francs to buy Alovera products for resale. These products are expensive and her salary does not permit her to acquire enough products to develop her business. This loan will thus allow her to increase her profit and improve her living conditions.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: renforcement fond de roulement

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel has been operating his mixed farm in Kisii town, Western Kenya for the past 20 years. His farm produces tea leaves, maize, beans, coffee, milk, vegetables and fish, which he sells to the local market. He is also employed as a watchman and also earns income from his kiosk in the same area.

Daniel is 45 years old, and a father of six children who are now aged between 5 and 23 years. All of his children attend school. 

Daniel has requested this loan from Juhudi Kilimo of 35, 000 Kenyan Shillings to purchase and insure a dairy cow. He says that the income from this loan will enable him to feed his family well and also to pay school fees for his children. In the future, he intends to own a posho (maize flour) mill and also expand his dairy production so that he can build a permanent house for the family.

His primary challenges have been lack of enough capital for expansion and thieves who steal fish from the pond. He appreciates that Juhudi came into their lives and has enlightened them on business management.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: José

texts.es:
José es un padre de familia de 46 años de edad que vive junto a su esposa y sus hijos en un caserío del distrito agrícola de Tambogrande, este distrito es uno de los principales productores de fruta en el norte del país, las frutas que produce suelen ser exportadas a diversos países den extranjero. Pertenece a la provincia de Piura y se encuentra situado en la región del mismo nombre, a mas de tres horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica a labores asociadas a la agricultura desde que era joven. El tiene algunas cabezas de ganado vacuno que le proveen diariamente de leche, la cual comercializa entre sus vecinos. Adicionalmente posee una pequeña extensión de terreno de cultivo en donde siembra mango y limón, las futas que suele cosechar las ofrece en venta a las plantas procesadoras que se encuentran instaladas en la zona. Con estas actividades el se encarga de asumir los gastos económicos de su familia.

José desea mejorar la alimentación de sus vacas para que produzcan mas leche, de este modo el puede incrementar sus ventas y aumentar sus ganancias, además también desea adquirir algunos fertilizantes para brindar mantenimiento a su cultivo y mejorar la producción de este. Para lograr su objetivo ha creído conveniente solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles.

José es una persona responsable, trabajadora y bastante entregada a su familia. Su mayor anhelo es seguir creciendo como empresario para poder brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida. En donde vive sus vecinos y conocidos le consideran una persona tranquila y de confianza.
texts.en:
José is a 48-year-old father who lives with his wife and children in a settlement of the agricultural district of Tambogrande. This district is one of the main fruit-producing areas in the north of the country. The fruits it produces are mainly exported to a range of foreign countries. It belongs to Piura province in the region of the same name, more than three hours from the city of Chiclayo, the capital of the Lambayeque region. José has worked in the field of agriculture since he was young. He has some cows which provide him with milk each day, which he sells to his neighbors. In addition, he has a small plot of farmland where he grows mangos and limes. When the fruit is harvested, he offers it for sale to the processing plants located in the area. With these activities, he is responsible for covering the expenses of his family. José would like to improve the nutrition of his cows so that they will produce more milk. In this way, he will be able to increase his sales and his earnings. In addition, he would like to buy some fertilizers to provide maintenance to his fields and improve their production. To achieve his objective, he has decided to request a loan for the first time from Edpyme Alternativa, in the amount of 1500 Peruvian new soles. José is a responsible, hard-working person who is very devoted to his family. His greatest desire is to continue growing as an entrepreneur, so that he can provide his family with a better quality of life. In the area where he lives, his neighbors and others who know him consider him a steady and trustworthy person.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying balanced feed to improve the production of his dairy cows

loans.name: Vincent

texts.en:
Vincent is 39 years old, married, and a father of two children aged 15 and 13. Both children attend school.  He has a mixed farm in Kisii town, Western Kenya, where he has been farming for the last 18 years. His main products are tea leaves, bananas, milk, chicken, maize and beans, which he sells at a local market and to other retailers.  He also works as a carpenter as another source of income. His primary challenges have been a lack of capital for expansion, fluctuating weather patterns, pests, and diseases, especially in his poultry. 

Vincent has requested a loan of 40,000 Kenyan Shillings from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. He says that the proceeds from milk sales will help him to feed his family well and to pay his children’s school fees.  In the future he plans to own three more dairy cows, open a kiosk in his area and, if possible, purchase a posho mill. He is grateful to the organisation for agreeing to lend to small-scale farmers who don’t have enough security.

loans.use: to purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Socorro

texts.es:
Socorro tiene 54 años D. edad, es casada y vive junto a su esposo en el caserío San Francisco, una zona rural del distrito D. Chulucanas, un distrito agrícola que pertenece a la provincia D. Morropón, D. encuentra situado en la región Piura, a mas D. tres horas y media D. la ciudad D. Chiclayo, capital D. la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica a la crianza y venta D. ovejas, ella cuenta con un rebaño D. ovejas que cría alimentándolas D. pastos naturales en un corral situado cerca a su vivienda. Cuando estas ya han alcanzado un buen nivel D. desarrollo las ofrece en venta a los negociantes que siempre visitan la zona en donD. vive. Con los ingresos que percibe D. esta actividad ayuda a su esposo a solventar los gastos económicos familiares.

Socorro desD. realizar algunos arreglos en los corrales, asimismo desea adquirir alimento balanceado para hacer que sus ovejas se desarrollen D. mejor manera y poder percibir mayores ingresos al momento D. venderlas. Para realizar esta acción ha creído conveniente solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito D. 1000 nuevos soles.

Ella es una mujer entregada a su familia y a u trabajo, sus dias transcurren en el cuidado D. su hogar y en D. sus animales. En la zona donD. vive sus vecinos la consideran una mujer tranquila y responsable.
texts.en:
Socorro, age 54, is married and lives with her husband in the San Francisco settlement. It is a rural area in the Chulucanas district, which is an agricultural district belonging to the Morropón province. It is situated in the Piura region at over three and a half hours from the city of Chiclayo, the capital of the Lambayeque region. She raises and sells sheep. She has a flock of sheep that she raises by feeding them natural grasses in corrals close to her house. When they have achieved a good level of development, she sells them to the businessmen who always visit the area where she lives. The income that she gets from this activity helps her husband pay the family’s expenses. Socorro wants to make some repairs to the corrals. She also wants to get balanced feed in order to have her sheep develop in a better way. This is so that she will be able to get greater earnings when it is time to sell them. In order to do this she believes it is advisable to request, for the first time, a loan from Edpyme Alternativa for 1,000 soles. She is a woman who is devoted to her family and her work. Her days pass by taking care of her home and her animals. In the area where she lives her neighbors consider her to be a level-headed and responsible woman.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy balanced feed and repair corrals in order to improve the way she raises sheep to sell

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is 59 years old and lives in Boochi Borabu, Kisii town, Western Kenya. She is married with six children who are now between the ages of 16 and 32. Four of the children attend school. She is a member of Itibo Zero Grazing Self Help Group, which is being funded by Juhudi Kilimo.  

Esther has been operating her mixed farm for the last thirty years. Her farm produces tea leaves, maize, beans and bananas, which she sells at the local Kenya Tea Development Authority.  She also operates a kiosk as her other source of income.

Esther has requested this loan of 40,000 Kenyan Shillings from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. She says that with the proceeds from the sale of milk she intends to pay her children’s school fees and increase her family’s nutritional intake by providing them with enough milk for consumption. In the future she hopes to increase the number of her dairy cows and expand her retail shop.

loans.use: to purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Belibetua

texts.en:
Belibetua is 51 years old, married, and the mother of four children aged between 12 and 30. One of her children still attends school. She has been practising mixed farming for over 30 years in Kisii town, Western Kenya. Her farm produces maize, beans, tea leaves, millet, chicken and vegetables, which she sells at the local market and at the Kenya Tea Development Authority. She also earns income by selling both new and second-hand clothes and operating a kiosk.

Belibetua has requested a loan of 30,000 Kenyan Shillings from Juhudi Kilimo to expand her cereal business. The proceeds from this loan will enable her to educate her child and feed her family well. In the future she plans to open a big retail shop in her locality specialising in East African agricultural goods.  

Her major challenges have been a lack of capital for expansion, bad debtors, pests and diseases which affect her crops and animals.  Nevertheless, she appreciates Juhudi’s partnership and is thankful to them for being part of her family’s lives.

loans.use: to expand her cereal business

loans.name: Celia

texts.es:
Celia tiene 37 años de edad, es separada y tiene dos hijos a su cargo. Reside en el caserío Tejedores, una zona rural del distrito de Tambogrande, zona agrícola caracterizada por producir frutas de exportación. Pertenece a la provincia de Piura y se encuentra ubicada en la región del mismo nombre, a mas de tres horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica a la venta de ropa para damas y caballeros. Ella adquiere su mercadería en las ciudades de Piura y Chiclayo y la distribuye entre sus clientes en base a pedidos. Ella es bastante conocidano solo en su cacerio sino que también lo es en los caserío de alrededor, siempre está en contacto con sus clientes ya que les deja la mercadería personalmente y, como trabaja al crédito, les realiza visitas semanales o quincenales.

Esta actividad es la unica con la que sostiene la economía de su familia por lo que siempre da lo mejor de si para para mantenerse en el negocio. Celia desea adquirir mas mercadería para ampliar su negocio, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 700 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.

Celia es una mujer trabajadora y luchadora, su mas grande anhelo es seguir creciendo hasta tener un negocio mas estable que le permita hacerse cargo del sostenimiento de su familia con mayor tranquilidad. En la zona donde vive ella es muy conocida y estimada por sus vecinos.
texts.en:
Celia is 37 years old, is separated and has 2 children under her care. She lives in the suburb of Tejedores, a rural zone in the Tambogrande district. Tejedores is an agricultural zone characterised by the production of fruit for export. It belongs to the Piura province, located in the region of the same name, more than 3 hours from Chiclayo city capital of the Lambayeque region in Peru. Celia sells men's and women's clothing. She acquires her merchandise in Piura and Chiclayo cities and distrbutes them to her clients through orders. Celia is quite well-known not only in her suburb but in the surrounding suburbs, and she is always in contact with her customers as she takes them their merchandise personally, and as she works on credit, she makes her visits weekly or fortnightly. This activity is the only activity that sustains her family economically, and so she always gives her best to maintain the business. Celia wants to acquire more merchandise to expand her business, and for this has decided for the first time to seek a loan of 700 nuevos soles form Edpyme Alternative to help her achieve her objective. Celia is a very hard-working woman who strives to succeed. Her biggest desire is to continue growing her business until it becomes more stable, allowing her to care for her family with greater peace. In the zone where she lives Celia is very well-known and respected by her neighbours.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase clothing to expand merchandise

loans.name: Perisikila

texts.en:
Perisikila, 65, is a widowed mother of seven adult children. She has been operating a mixed farm in Kisii town, Western Kenya for over forty years. Her main products are maize, beans, bananas, and tea leaves, which she sells at the local markets and at the Kenya Tea Development Authority.

Perisikila has requested her second loan from Juhudi Kilimo, worth 20,000 Kenyan Shillings, to expand her cereal business by purchasing four sacks of rice from Tanzania and selling it locally. She says that this project will keep her busy, help her avoid stress and eat well. She appreciates how Juhudi has assisted her, especially with her first loan, which enabled her to acquire a dairy cow and to pay for hospital bills caused by eye sight problems from which she has recovered. In the future, Perisikila plans to open a sizeable retail shop which will not require her to travel a lot. This will be a benefit because of her advanced age.

loans.use: to expand her cereal business

loans.name: Dioscoro

texts.en:
Dioscoro R. is from the town of Trinidad. He is 40 years old, married, and has 3 school-aged children. To earn a living, he makes "bahalina" and sells it in the community. Bahalina is a coconut wine famous all over the Philippines and said to have health benefits. Dioscoro is doing his best to provide for his family. He works hard to give his children a proper education. He also hopes for his business to grow bigger.

Dioscoro joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. He has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI, and is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to make improvements to his family’s house and living conditions.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: María Dionisia

texts.es:
María Dionicia tiene 50 años de edad, es separada y vive en caserío Cruz del Medano, una zona rural perteneciente al distrito de Mórrope. Un distrito conformado por varios caseríos que distan mucho entre si. La zona pertenece a la provincia de Lambayeque y se encuentra ubicada a mas de una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a la compra y venta de ganado vacuno y ganado menor. Ella compra animales a sus vecinos y pobladores de zonas aledañas y los vuelve a vender a los negociantes que siempre visitan la zona. Adicionalmente se dedica a brindar servicio de costura en un pequeño taller instalado en su domicilio. Con estas actividades sustenta la economía de su familia.

María necesita adquirir mas animales para ampliar su negocio de compra y venta, como no cuenta con el capital suficiente para realizar esta acción se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles que le permitan realizar su objetivo.

Maria es una mujer trabajadora y empeñosa. Su mayor anhelo es seguir creciendo como empresaria para mejorar su calidad de vida y la calidad de vida de su familia. En la zona donde vive sus vecinos y conocidos la estiman mucho y la consideran una mujer de confianza.
texts.en:
María Dionicia is 50 years old, is separated and lives in the suburb of Cruz del Medano, a rural zone belonging to the Mórrope district. This district is made up of various suburbs very far apart. The zone belongs to the Lambayeque province, and is located more than an hour from Chiclayo. María buys and sells cattle and smaller livestock. She purchases animals from her neighbours and villagers in the zones around and returns to sell them to the businesspeople that always visit the zone. She also provides a dress-making service in a small workshop installed in her house, and with these activities she sustains her families. María needs to acquire more animals to increase her buying and selling business, and as she doesn't have sufficient capital to do this she has seen it necessary for the first time to seek a loan from Edpyme Alternative for 1500 nuevos solves, which will allow her to achieve her objective. María is a very hard-working and entrepreneurial woman. Her biggest desire is to continue growing as a businesswoman to improve her quality of life and the quality of life of her family. In the zone where she lives her neighbours and acquaintances respect her greatly and consider her a trustworthy woman.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase animals

loans.name: Magaly Rocio

texts.es:
Magaly tiene 22 años de edad, es madre soltera y tiene un hijo dependiente, reside junto a sus padre en una zona urbano marginal de la ciudad de Lambayeque. Una ciudad de regular movimiento comercial que se encuentra ubicada a mas de veinte minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales desde hace tres años en su domicilio. Ella suele criar aves de corral en corrales instalados en la parte posterior de su vivienda y las alimenta de granos y pastos, cuando ya han alcanzado un buen nivel de desarrollo las ofrece en venta a los negociantes que visitan la zona con frecuencia. Con los ingresos que percibe de esta actividad se encarga de solventar sus gastos personales y ayudar al sostenimiento de su menor hijo.

Magaly desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de animales y alimento balanceado para incrementar su nivel de ventas e ingresos. Como no cuenta con capital suficiente para realizar esta acción de ha vistoen la necesidad de solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 800 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.

Magaly es una mujer luchadora y emprendedora, su mayor anhelo es brindarle a su menor hijo la oportunidad de tener un futuro estable. En la zona donde vive las personas que le conocen la consideran una mujer tranquila y responsable.
texts.en:
Magaly is 22 years old and is a single mother with one dependent child. She lives together with her father in an urban zone on the margins of Lambayeque city. It is a city with great commercial movement which is located more than 20 minutes from Chiclayo city. Magaly has bred and sold animals in her house for over 3 years. She breeds birds in pens installed behind her home and feeds them grains and grasses. When they reach a certain level of development she sells them to businesspeople who frequently visit the zone. With the income she receives from this activity she covers her personal costs and helps to sustain her small son. Magaly wants to increase her business by purchasing animals and balanced feed to increase her levels of sales and earnings. As she doesn't have sufficient capital to do this she has deemed it necessary for the first time to seek a loan from Edpyme Alternative for 800 nuevos soles, which will help her achieve her objectives. Magaly is a hard-working and entrepreneurial woman. Her biggest dream is to give her son a stable future. In the zone where she lives she is known as a calm and responsible woman.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase small animals and balanced feed

loans.name: Paula

texts.es:
Paula tiene 33 años D. edad resiD. en el Municipio D. San Francisco Gotera Departamento D. Morazán, es madre soltera vive con madre y su hijo D. 18 años D. edad, la familia depenD. económicamente D. los ingresos del negocio, ella posee un puesto en el mercado donD. venD. comida.
Hace a siete años se dedica a la venta D. comida, posee su comedor en el mercado municipal D. San francisco Gotera, venD. desayunos y almuerzos, su hijo trabaja en un taller D. estructuras metálicas para ahorrar ya que él quiere estudias en la universidad, Paula actualmente está solicitando un préstamo para invertir en la compra D. una refrigeradora ya que esto le permitirá conservas mas los alimentos y bebidas refrescantes.
Los sueños D. Paula son apoyar a su hijo con realizar los estudios universitarios, trabajar para incrementar el negocio y tener casa propia, mejorar las condiciones D. vida D. la familia
texts.en:
Paula is 33, and lives in the San Francisco Gotera town, Morazán department. She is a single mother and lives with her mother and 18 year old son. The family depends on the income from her business. She has a stand in the market where she sells food. Seven years ago she started selling food. She has a dining area in the city market of San Francisco Gotera where she sells breakfasts and lunches. Her son works in a shop making metal structures to save money now that he wants to study at the university. Paula is currently requesting a loan to buy a refrigerator since this will allow her to keep the food and soft drinks better. Her dream is to support her son with his university studies, work to increase her business, and to have her own house-all of which will improve the living conditions of her family.

Translated from Spanish by Miriam Palacio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a refrigerator since this will allow her to keep the food and soft drinks better.

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es:
Juan Carlos tiene 32 años de edad, es casado y tiene dos hijos dependientes. Vive ujunto a su familia en el caserío Lagunas, una zona rural del distrito de Mórrope, este distrito está conformado por varios caseríos que distan mucho entre sí, la zona pertenece a la provincia de Lambayeque y se encuentra ubicado a una hora y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales desde hace cinco años, el cría aves de corral en diversos ambientes ubicados en la parte posterior de su vivienda. Cuando estos ya han alcanzado un buen nivel de desarrollo los ofrece en venta a los negociantes que siempre visitan la zona en donde vive. Adicionalmente trabaja como auxiliar de servicios en un centro educativo de su localidad. Con estas actividades Juan Carlos solventa los gastos económicos de su familia.

Juan Carlos desea adquirir mas animales para ampliar su negocio de crianza y venta, asimismo planea acondicionar mas corrales y comprar alimento balanceado para garantizar un buen desarrollo de los mismos, como no tiene capital para realizar esta acción ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.

Juan Carlos es un padre trabajador y responsable. Su mayor anhelo es seguir trabajando para brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida. En la zona donde vive es bastante conocido y estimado por sus vecinos y amigos.
texts.en:
Juan Carlos is 32 years old. He is married with two children. He lives with his family in the shanty town of Lagunas in the rural zone of Mórrope. The area is made of a lot of shanty towns with large distances between them. The area is part of the Lambayeque province and is located an hour and a half from the city of Chiclayo. Juan Carlos has been raising and selling animals for five years. He raises farmyard birds in various areas behind his home. After the birds have reached a certain level of physical development, Juan Carlos sells them to businessmen who always visit the area where he lives. Additionally, he works as a service assistant in a local school. With these jobs, Juan Carlos supports his family's spending. Juan Carlos wants to get more animals to increase his business of raising and selling them, so he plans to build more corrals and buy animal food to guarantee the animals' proper development. Since he doesn't have the money to realize these plans, he has asked Edpyme Alternative for a loan of 1500 nuevos soles that will help him attain his goals. Juan Carlos is a hard-working responsible father. His biggest desire in life is to continue working so he can provide his family a better quality of live. He is very well known in the area where he lives and is well-liked among neighbors and friends.

Translated from Spanish by Lydia Brantley, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying animals to raise and sell

loans.name: Cony

texts.es: La señora Quiñones es Originaria de la Ciudad de León, es de oficio Maestra ,su núcleo familiar está compuesto por tres personas Mayores de edad, posee su propia casa  y su esposo trabaja en un proyecto de medio ambiente, este financiamiento  se le ha otorgado de parte de ceprodel  para gastos Universitario.
texts.en:
Ms. Quiñones is a native of the city of León. She is a teacher by profession, and her family unit includes three elderly people. She has her own house, and her husband is working on an environmental project. This loan has been granted to her by Ceprodel for university expenses [for her daughter].

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Paying for her daughter's university courses

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buying fertilizer and chicken droppings to enrich his soil

loans.name: Marta Irene

texts.es:
La señora O. López es Originaria de la comarca el Tololar , es de oficio Maestra de primaria en la misma comarca , su núcleo familiar está compuesto por dos personas menores de edad, este cliente posee una pequeña vivienda que poco a poco ha ido mejorando con esfuerzos propios, este es el octavo financiamiento
Que se le ha otorgado de parte de ceprodel  para gastos personales y gastos médicos.
texts.en:
Ms. O. López is a native of the Tololar district. She is an elementary school teacher by profession, in the same district. Her family unit includes two minor children. The borrower owns a small home which she has gradually been improving through her own efforts. This is her eighth loan, which has been granted by CEPRODEL for personal and medical expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Paying medical expenses

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Restocking her store

loans.name: Jerardo Francisco

texts.es: Este cliente es originario de la comarca las mercedes Quezalguaque, actualmente se dedica a la actividad Agrícola como es la siembra de maíz y Ajonjolí, también convina otra actividad como es el traslado al país de costa Rica a trabajar de Noviembre A Mayo en la temporada de cosecha de Melones, actividad que tiene 12 años de efectuarla y de esa manera ha mejorado su nivel de vida, al momento del viaje   deja su producción aquí en su casa ya cosechado es padre de 2 hijos , un varón de 19 años estudia y trabaja con él una mujer de 30años que trabaja en una clínica provisional como cajera de farmacia, es soltera, en su casa tiene una nieta y su esposa, que son los miembros de la familia que viven juntos, se puede observar que son una familia respetosa, unida y que trabajan en conjunto para  lograr el objetivo de mejorar las condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
This borrower is a native of the district of Las Mercedes, Quezalguaque. He currently works in agriculture, for instance growing corn and sesame. He also works on contract doing other activities; for example, he moves to the country of Costa Rica to work from November to May, during the melon harvest season. He has done this work for 12 years, and it has allowed him to improve his standard of living. When he travels, he leaves his crops already harvested at home. He is the father of 2 children: a 19-year-old boy, who studies and works with him, and a 30-year-old woman who works in a health clinic as a pharmacy cashier and is single. In his home, he has a granddaughter and his wife, who are the family members who live together. It can be observed that they are a respectful and united family, and that they work together to achieve the objective of improving their standard of living.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying agricultural supplies and preparing the soil

loans.use: Restocking vegetables on a regular basis

loans.use: Selling vegetables and food condiments

loans.use: Processing and selling cassava flour

loans.use: Storing and selling corn

loans.name: Maria Norma

texts.es: Este cliente es originario del poblado de Quezalguaque, ella se dedica a la venta de cosméticos y venta de leche, producción que sacan del ganado que tienen en conjunto con su marido desde hace varios años, inventario que han venido formando por esfuerzo propio, ya que su marido es de oficio albañil y trabaja donde lo buscan, quedándose siempre con la dirección del manejo del hato ganadero con su hijo quienes se involucran de manera familiar siempre en busca de mejorar su nivel de vida, dicho crédito lo utilizan para el alquiler de pasto   ya que todavía no tienen terreno propio, y de esa manera han sacado a sus hijos adelante y han mejorado su nivel de vida
texts.en:
This client is from the town of Quezalguaque. She sells cosmetics and milk, which she gets from the cattle she has had with her husband for several years. They were able to obtain the cattle by their own hard work. Her husband is a bricklayer and works where ever he is needed. She manages the cattle herd with their son and as a family they are always looking to improve their quality of life. They will use the loan to rent pasture since they still don't have their own land. In this way, they have gotten their kids ahead and improved their quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For pasture rental expenses
