In addition to providing economic opportunity to their clients, Patan BPW seeks to empower Nepali women within the home and community.  For more information about Patan BPW, visit our partner page and keep an eye out for new loans and borrower updates.

loans.use: To increase the store inventory

loans.name: Tserennadmid

texts.en: Tserennadmid B. is 28 years old and lives with her two younger brothers in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia in a ger, a traditional nomadic housing tent in her grandmother's yard. Both of her brothers are students. Tserennadmid operates copying, scanning and printing services at a rented space in an internet center where she previously worked. She began her service a year ago and has purchased a copying machine with her loan revenues. Now her daily income reaches 30,000 MNT approximately. She wants to buy new equipment and devices for her computer service business to improve work effectiveness and efficiency and is trying her best to afford her brothers' tuition fees. Tserennadmid is requesting an 850,000 MNT to buy a new printer and computer to increase her work output.

loans.use: To buy a new printer and computer

loans.name: Tseren-Ochir

texts.en: Tseren-Ochir C. is 30 years old and lives with his wife and three children in Govi-Altay province, western of Mongolia in their own ger, a traditional nomadic housing tent. Tseren-Ochir began his meat retailing business in 2008 with the help of his wife. He purchases meat in bulk from surrounding regions and his wife is responsible for the retailing, which she manages at a rented stall in their town market. The two requested a 100,000 MNT loan in 2008 and paid back in full. With their business revenues, they have purchased a small truck, which Tseren-Ochir uses for his transportation business. Both of them are hard-working people who always see a bright future. Tseren-Ochir wants to expand his business, buy a large amount of meat from the countryside during this period when the prices are lower and purchase a yard for his family with his business revenues. He is requesting a 2,000,000 MNT loan in order to purchase meat in bulk and resell at higher prices.

loans.use: To purchase meat in bulk

loans.name: Altantsetseg

texts.en: Altantsetseg S. is 38 years old and lives with her husband and two teenage children in Govi-Altai province, western of Mongolia. She and her family have been living in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent since 1995. Both her children attend a local middle school and her husband manages a taxi service in their town. Altantsetseg began her business in 1995. From 1988 through 1992, Altantsetseg attended a construction college majoring as a decorator and from 1993 to 1995, she worked as a shoe repairwoman in a local public service center. Since 2000, Altantsetseg has been working as a shoe repairwoman in the cold season and when the summer comes, she makes construction decorations in her town. In 2008, Altantsetseg received a 1,000,000 MNT loan from Xacbank in order to increase her business working capital. With her business revenues, she purchased two small cars. She attributes her business success to both her decorating and shoe repairing skills. Altantsetseg is a hard-working and optimistic woman who says, "Our family is saving money to build a house in the coming year where we will be living more comfortably". She is requesting a 1,500,000 MNT loan in order to purchase leather, fabric, heels and glue for her shoe repair business.

loans.use: To purchase leather, fabric, heels and glue

loans.name: Maritha

texts.en:
Maritha has a mixed farm in the town of Kisii in Western Kenya. She has been practicing mixed farming for the last 50 years and has employed two farmhands. Her farm produces maize, beans, coffee and tea, which she sells locally.

Maritha is 63 years old and a widowed mother of eight children who are all adults.

Maritha has requested this loan of 45,000 Kenyan Shillings from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. She says this dairy cow will enable her family to get enough milk for consumption and that the income from the sale of milk will be used to improve the living standards of the family.

In the future, she hopes to increase her acreage of maize, beans and tea, hence maximizing from economies of scale. She says that she will continue to work together with Juhudi Kilimo in the future because she has seen the benefits.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Madina

texts.en:
Madina F. is 51 years old. She is married and has two children. She is a very active woman. Ten years ago, Madina started the business of poultry breeding. She raises the chickens and then sells them at the local market, usually to local restaurants. With the income she generates, she provides a better quality of life for her children.

Despite recent success, since her business is still quite small, it doesn't generate enough income for the whole family. Madina would like to request a loan to expand her business and increase her family income. She will use the profit generated from the business to repay the loan on time. She is asking for a loan of 600 AZN in order to buy more chickens to sell when they are fully grown.

loans.use: To purchase more chicken

loans.name: Robinson

texts.en:
Robinson is a hardworking farmer from the town of Kisii in Western Kenya. He has been operating his mixed farm for the last 15 years. His main products are maize, beans, coffee, tea and sugarcane, which he sells to the local market and other institutions. He also earns income from his construction services.

Robinson has requested a loan from Juhudi Kilimo for 45,000 Kenyan Shillings to purchase and insure a dairy cow. The proceeds from the sale of milk will go towards the education of his children and the health of his family. He will also be able to improve the nutrition of his family since they will have enough milk for consumption.

Robinson is 38 years old and married with three children who are now between the ages of 6 and 13. All the children attend school.

His major challenges are lack of enough capital for expansion, diseases and lack of market. He is requesting more financial support to fight poverty and improve the living standards of the less fortunate.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Qadamxeyir

texts.en: Qadamxeyir A. is 56 years old and a housewife. She’s been immersed in raising animals since her childhood and for that reason, she decided to remain in this industry. Qadamxeyir works very hard to obtain the income (150-200 AZN) that will satisfy her family’s needs. She sells her livestock to the local cafes and butchers. She is married and has three sons.  She wants to buy more animals and, in this way, increase her income. For this reason, she applied for a loan of 800 AZN.

loans.use: To purchase two cattle

loans.name: Oqtay

texts.en: Oqtay H. is a successful father and dedicated husband. Oqtay began a small grocery store 9 years ago with his savings. He sells watermelons and other seasonal fruits in his own shop. He is assisted by his wife, who helps him to serve his clients. Today his clientele has grown greater and his store has become more popular. His monthly income is about 300-600 AZN. He is asking for a loan of 900 AZN so that he may expand the variety of goods that are sold in his store.

loans.use: to purchase more merchandise

loans.name: Fikret

texts.en: Fikret  S. is 52 years old and lives with his wife and three children. For about sixteen years, he has dedicated himself to farming wheat and vegetables. Fikret enjoys being a farmer and finds harvesting his crops especially gratifying. On the other hand, the most tedious parts of farming are the preparation of land for planting and protecting the crops from insects that spoil his harvest. Fortunately for Fikret, his products are in high demand in his area and fetch high prices at the market. His monthly income is about 250-350 AZN. He has applied for an 800 AZN loan to purchase more seeds and fertilizer.

loans.use: to purchase more seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Imammaddin

texts.en: Imammaddin Q. is 35 years old and married. He has had a grocery store for 2 years; he started it with his own resources through his work. His wife is the one who works in the store. Imammaddin uses all his income to improve living conditions for his two children. He wants to increase the sales of new products preferred by his clients. He applied for a 900 AZN loan to purchase products such as bread, tinned goods, sweets and juices to increase his revenue.

loans.use: to purchase more products to sell

loans.name: Janepher

texts.en:
Janepher is a farmer and an active member of the Mosebeti Group in Kisii town, Western Kenya. She has a mixed farm which produces bananas, sugarcane, tea, coffee and maize. She sells her products to the local market. Janepher is 47 years old. She is married and has been blessed with 6 children who are all adults.

Janepher has requested this loan of 45,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. She hopes that her milk production will increase, as this would increase her income. Her biggest challenge is the unpredictable prices for her products. Janepher hopes to improve her farming activities in the future and apply for another loan after she completes this current one.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Dominic

texts.en:
Dominic is a farmer from the town of Kisii in Western Kenya.  He has been operating his mixed farm for the last 40 years and has employed three people from his community. His main products are bananas, maize, tea, sugarcane and tree seedlings which he sells to the local market.

Dominic is 61 years old. He is married and has been blessed with 12 children who are between the ages of 12 and 30. Four of the children are currently in school. Dominic has requested this loan of 45,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. He says that this loan will enable him to acquire a quality dairy cow that will produce enough milk for sale and consumption. He faces the challenges of lack of adequate market for his products and lack of capital to expand his business. He expects to expand his farming business in the future and hopes to earn more income from farming.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Nazim

texts.en: Nazim A. dedicated himself to the raising of poultry 15 years ago. He is married and is a father who needs to support his children, who help him with the business. Nazim is faced with the need to purchase more chickens, which are in very high demand. His monthly income is about 250-300 AZN. He has applied for a loan of 1,000 AZN in order to increase his income. He will use this loan to purchase more chickens and improve his living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase more chickens

loans.name: Rosa Candelaria

texts.es: Rosa Candelaria T. G. de 26 años de edad, es una persona muy esforzada la cual se dedica a trabajar en su negocio propio en el cual comercializa frutas y verduras. Ella vive junto a su esposo, dos hijos menores de edad, los cuales se dedican a estudiar, y junto a su madre la cual le ayuda con todos los quehaceres del hogar. Rosa es trabajadora y responsable, que como toda buena madre se esfuerza por realizar lo mejor posible su trabaja para brindarle la ayuda necesaria a su esposo. Ella solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda comprar mayor cantidad de  frutas y verduras, y de esta forma aprovechar al máximo el tiempo que posee de estar ubicada con su venta en el mercado municipal de Jiquilisco, mismo municipio en el cual vive junto a su familia, en donde es muy conocida por una gran cantidad de personas las cuales desde hace mucho años atrás compran sus productos. Rosa desea poder comprar una gran variedad de frutas y verduras y así de esta forma captar la atención de clientes nuevos los cuales le permitan hacer crecer su negocio y de esta forma mejorar sus ganancias lo cual es muy importante para Rosa puesto que desea darle lo mejor a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Rosa Candelaria T. G. is 26 years old and puts great effort into her business, the sale of fruits and vegetables. She lives with her husband, her two young children who attend school, and her mother who helps with the housework. Rosa is responsible and hard working. Like any good mother she makes an extra effort to do her best in her work so that she can give her husband the necessary help. She is asking for this loan so that she buy larger quantities of fruits and vegetables and be able to take advantage of the time that she spends at her point of sale at the Jiquilisco city market. This is the same city where she and her family live. She is well known here by many people, who have been buying her products from her for many years. Rosa would like to buy a large quantity of fruits and vegetables so that she can capture the attention of new customers, which will allow her to grow her business and improve her income. This is very important to Rosa, because she wants to give the best to her children.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Fruits and vegetables

loans.name: José Romeo

texts.es: José Romeo G. M. de 39 años de edad, reside en Cantón Ojo Agua, el cual se encuentra en el departamento de Usulután, al oriente del país, él vive junto a su esposa, una madre de familia muy  responsable y esmerada por el bien de su casa y su familia, y así también vive junto a sus dos hijos, los cuales estudian educación básica en la escuela del lugar. José posee su propio negocio el cual esta ubicado en su casa de habitación, en el cual se dedica a elaborar diferentes estructuras metálicas como: balcones, puertas, escaleras, portones y otras estructuras más que sus clientes le piden. Debido a la amplia experiencia que José posee en este trabajo cuenta con muchos clientes quienes se sienten muy satisfechos con su trabajo y por ser una persona muy responsable quien en estos últimos 15 años de trabajo siempre ha dado lo mejor de si. José solicita un préstamo con el deseo de poder comprar más metal para invertir en el negocio y de esta forma elaborar más trabajo, así mismo el desea comprar  algunas herramientas nuevas para elaborar mejor su trabajo. José es una persona que cuenta con muy buenas referencias por parte de sus vecinos y clientes, y así mismo se destaca por ser muy trabajador y por esforzarse por darle lo mejor a su familia.
texts.en:
José Romeo G. M. is 39 years old and lives in Cantón Ojo Agua, which is located within the Usulután department, in the eastern part of the country. He lives with his wife, who is a very responsible mother who cares for the wellbeing of her home and family. They have two children who attend the local school. José runs his own business out of his home, where he manufactures various types of metal structures, such as balconies, doors, stairs, gates, and other things that his customers request. José is very experienced, so he has many customers who are satisfied with his workmanship. He is a very responsible person who, for the past 15 years, has always given his best. He is asking for this loan so that he can buy more metal for his business, which will allow him to complete more jobs. He also wants to buy some new tools so that he can do his job better. José comes with very good references from his neighbors and customers. He distinguishes himself as being a hard worker who makes a great effort to bringing the best for his family.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Supplies

loans.name: Unurbat

texts.en:
Mr. Unurbat is 33 years old and lives with his wife and two children, ages 9 and 12. Until 2000, he ran a farming business growing livestock in the Dundgovi province of Mongolia. Winter 2000 was one of the coldest in past decade. During that winter, Mr. Unurbat lost most of his livestock and had to move to Ulaanbaatar, the capital city. Then he bought a second-hand minivan and started running a transportation business quite successfully. 

His wife Altantsetseg works with him as a cashier. Every three years, they have to renew the van because of the transportation authority's safety requirements. 

In 2009, they built a 56-square-meter wooden house using their savings. The reason they are asking for this loan is to buy some insulation materials to make the house warmer during the winter. They also want to make a separate room for their kids.

loans.use: To buy some insulation materials to make the house warmer during the winter

loans.name: Chhom

texts.en:
Mr. Chhom C. is an old man whose wife appears in the photo here. Chhom C. and his wife have been in the farming business for years. They raise pigs and crops on their own farmland and typically generate an income of $3 per day. 

Additionally, Chhom C. always takes time to travel to the forest, where he either finds firewood or buys it from the rural people and then sells it at his house. 

Chhom C. is concerned that he faces difficulty with irrigating his crops due to his farm being located far away from the water system. To help solve the problem, Chhom C. has applied for a loan to buy a machine that he will use to pump water for his crop.

loans.use: To buy a machine to pump water for his crops

loans.name: Sokhom's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Sokhom E., age 46, is the leader of this group loan, having been selected by the other members of the group. They are located in Krapeu Ha village in Kandal province. Each member of this group will use their portion of the loan to support their different businesses.

Mrs. Sokhom E. is a grocery seller while her husband, Mr. Lors Khann, is a Khmer cake seller in the local village. With both of these occupations, they are able to earn a small income to support their family.  

In order to support these businesses, Mrs. Sokhom E. will use the loan from AMK to buy more groceries to resell and to buy a flour mill to support her husband's business. This couple has five children; one is on the staff of an organization while the other four are students and also help their parents' businesses.

loans.use: buying groceries for resale; buying a flour mill

loans.name: Samorn

texts.en:
Mrs. Samorn M. is a villager in Si Sla village, Takeo province, and she was born in 1961. She is a farmer who owns a two-hectare plot of land to cultivate rice to sell to support her family. Her husband, Mr. Vuthy Vong, is a soldier who gets a low salary to help support his family. 

Her problem is that her field is far away from an irrigation system, and she does not have enough money to solve that problem. So to improve her production, Mrs. Samorn M. is seeking a loan to buy a pump machine, and with the rest of the loan she will buy fertilizer, pesticide, and hire a plow machine to plow her field. 

She is the mother of a child who is now married. Her husband is shown in the photo with her.

loans.use: To buy a pump machine

loans.name: Yorn's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Yorn P., 58, is the leader of this group loan, having been selected by its members who all live in Ta Kdol village in Kandal province. All members will use their portion of the loan for different purposes.

Mrs. Yorn P. is a grocery seller in the local village. This business provides a small income to support the family. Since her business is going well, and in order to increase her income to help the family, she decided to ask for a loan to buy more groceries to sell. Mrs. Yorn P. is a widow with a child who is a taxi driver.

loans.use: To buy more groceries to sell

loans.name: Chea

texts.en:
Mrs. Chea S., who is a villager in Si Sla village in Takeo province, was born in 1952. She owns a general store in her village where she sells groceries to earn a good profit to support her family. Her husband, Mr. Mean Un, is a farmer who owns a half-hectare plot of land to cultivate rice to sell to help support his family. 

Since her current business is going well, she wants to expand it. So to improve her store, Mrs. Chea S. is seeking a loan to buy more groceries to resell. With the rest of the loan she will buy fertilizer, pesticide, and hire a plow machine to plow her field. 

She is the mother of three children, one of whom is attending school, while the others are laborers. Her husband is shown in the photo with her.

loans.use: To buy more groceries

loans.name: 080505-Hoang Thinh-Hoang Hoa Group

texts.en:
Khanh H. T., 28, lives in the town of H. Hoa-Thanh Hoa. Khanh is the leader of a 8-member loan group. Although each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsibL. for repaying the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is 080505-H. Thinh-H. Hoa.

Khanh is married and has two young children. To making a living, Khanh operates a family member's business raising livestock. The main source of income comes from raising cattL. for saL..  Khanh has been engaged in this business for over five years and earns approximately 1,200,000 VND a month.

In 2008, Khanh joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Khanh has successfully repaid a previous loan of 1,274,400 VND from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. This previous loan was used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell.  She is now requesting a new loan of 3,079,800 VND which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell.  The loan will be the second loan taken out by the borrower from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  Khanh plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About the other borrowers in the group:

1.  H. T. Hien is a 25-year-old femaL. who is requesting a 3,079,800 VND loan to support her business in raising livestock.

2.  N. T. My is a 65-year-old femaL. who is requesting a 2,442,600 VND loan to support her business raising livestock.

3.  H. T. Huong is a 22-year-old femaL. who is requesting a 3,079,800 VND loan to support her business raising livestock.

4.  L. T. Loan is a 53-year-old femaL. who is requesting a 2,124,000 VND loan to support her her business raising livestock.

5.  H. T. Toi is a 30-year-old femaL. who is requesting a 3,079,800 VND loan to support her business raising livestock.

6.  H. T. Ai is a 60-year-old femaL. who is requesting a 3,079,800 VND loan to support her business raising livestock.

7.  H. T. Lai is a 42-year-old femaL. who is requesting a 3,079,800 VND loan to support her business raising livestock.

About Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

The mission of the Thanh Hoa Fund Poor Women (FPW) is to provide sustainabL. financial services to disadvantaged women in rural areas in the Thanh Hoa province.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation. Because manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for its Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English whiL. providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

Khanh H. T. (39) là 28 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố H. Hoa-Thanh Hoa.  Khanh là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 8 các thành viên.  Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là 080505-H. Thinh-H. Hoa (080505-H. Thinh-H. Hoa).

Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ chăn nuôi gia súc để bán.  Khanh thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 5 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, Khanh kiếm được khoảng 1,200,000 VND.  Vào 2008, Khanh đã tham gia Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải T.ện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  Khanh đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 1,274,400 VND từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua gia súc còn nhỏ để nuôi & bán sau này.  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 3,079,800 VND.

Khoản vay sẽ là 2nd khoản vay của người vay từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:

1.  H. T. Hien (44) là 25 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 3079800 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.

2.  N. T. My (34) là 65 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 2442600 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.

3.  H. T. Huong (45) là 22 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 3079800 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.

4.  L. T. Loan (46) là 53 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 2124000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.

5.  H. T. Toi (47) là 30 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 3079800 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.

6.  H. T. Ai (30) là 60 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 3079800 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.

7.  H. T. Lai (40) là 42 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 3079800 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.

Về Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

Nhiệm vụ của Quỹ Hỗ trợ Phụ Nữ Nghèo Thanh Hóa (FPW) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính bền vững cho những người phụ nữ kém may mắn ở các vùng nông thôn tỉnh Thanh Hóa.

*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  ."

loans.use: To purchase baby livestock to raise and sell

loans.name: Sor

texts.en:
Ms. Sor L.  and her husband, Mr. Mi Li, live in a village aL. National Road Number 1 about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh. They have six children: two sons and four daughters. 

Sor has her own spinning machine and she was hired by her fellow villagers to spin. She works at her home. She wants to buy an additional spinning machine to generate income, but she does not have money. So, she is asking for a loan in the amount of $1,000.

loans.use: To purchase additional spinning machine.

loans.name: Yim

texts.en:
Mrs. Yim M. was born in 1974 and she lives in Srae Boeng village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a 5.5 hectare plot of land to cultivate rice to sell to support her family. Her husband. Mr. Sao Nuon, owns an agricultural machine, but works as a fisherman. 

Her problem is that the agricultural machine is too old to use but she does not have enough money to solve this problem. Mrs. Yim M. is applying for a loan to buy an agricultural machine to use instead of the old one. 

She is the mother of four children who are all studying in school as well as helping with their parents’ businesses. Her husband is shown in the photo with her.

loans.use: To buy an agricultural machine

loans.name: Sokhoeun

texts.en:
Mrs. Sokhoeun L., 41, and her husband Mr. Bros Khvan live aL. National Road Number 1, about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital of Cambodia. They were married in 1997 and have three children: one son and two daughters. Two of them are in school and the other stays at home. 

Sokhoeun has been producing rice wine and raising pigs for more than 12 years. Her husband is a driver. Sokhoeun asked for a Kiva loan once before. She is now requesting her second loan of $500. She will use part of her loan to repair the house where she lives and part of it to continue raising pigs and producing rice wine.

loans.use: To repair her house and to support her business

loans.name: Noem

texts.en:
Mrs. Noem S., who was born in 1974, lives In Mea Neak village in Takeo province. She and her husband, Mr. Vorn Sout, are farmers who own a 3.5 hectare plot of land to cultivate rice to sell to support their family. They own a plow machine and a harvest machine. Through those activities, this couple tries to work hard but they can earn very little money to support their family. 

To improve this condition, Mrs. Noem S. wants to start a new business and is seeking a loan to buy pig food and ten piglets for breeding. She is the mother of three children, one of whom is studying in school, while the others are helping with their parents’ businesses. Her husband is shown in the picture with her.

loans.use: To buy pig food and ten piglets for breeding

loans.name: Ankhzaya

texts.en: Mrs Ankhzaya is 25 years old. She lives with her husband and 3-year-old daughter in a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent in the Mongolian capital city Ulaanbaatar. Until 2008, Ankhzaya worked in a printing factory. Then she decided to open her own printing company. The company does all kinds of printing such as name cards, invitations, and certificates, as well as printing on items such as frames or cups. She is requesting this loan because she wants to increase her profit. She wants to buy a new printer and some printing materials such as color cartridges, different quality papers, frames, and glasses. Ankhzaya’s goal is to build her own house.

loans.use: To purchase more supplies.

loans.name: 080703-Hoang Thinh-Hoang Hoa Group

texts.en:
Ha N. T., 32, lives in the town of H. Hoa-Thanh Hoa. Ha is the leader of a 4-member group loan. Although each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsibL. for repaying the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is 080703-H. Thinh-H. Hoa.

Ha is married and has three young children. To make a living, Ha operates a family member's manufacturing business. The main source of income for the business comes from manufacturing and selling plastic products to local businesses and community members. Ha has been engaged in this business for one year and earns approximately 2,000,000 VND a month.

In 2010, Ha joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. This is her first loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. She is requesting a loan of 3,079,800 VND, which will be used to purchase raw materials to manufacture additional products. Ha plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About the Other Borrowers in the Group:

1.  L. T. Yen is a 30 year-old femaL. who is requesting a 3,079.800 VND loan to support her business in the manufacturing sector.


2.  H. T. Duyen is a 35 year-old femaL. who is requesting a 3,079,800 VND loan to support her business in the manufacturing sector.


3.  L. T. Thanh is a 31 year-old femaL. who is requesting a 3,079,800 VND loan to support her business in the manufacturing sector.


About Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

The mission of the Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women (FPW) is to provide sustainabL. financial services to disadvantaged women in rural areas of the Thanh Hoa province.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation. Because manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for its Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English whiL. providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

Ha N. T. (32) là 32 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố H. Hoa-Thanh Hoa.  Ha là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 4 các thành viên.  Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là 080703-H. Thinh-H. Hoa (080703-H. Thinh-H. Hoa).

Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ sản xuất & bán các sản phẩm bằng nhựa cho các doanh nghiệp và người dân trong cộng đồng địa phương.  Ha thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 1 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, Ha kiếm được khoảng 2,000,000 VND.  Vào 2010, Ha đã tham gia Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải T.ện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  Ha đề nghị khoản vay lần đầu tiên từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.    Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 3,079,800 VND.

Khoản vay sẽ là 1st khoản vay của người vay từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:

1.  L. T. Yen (19) là 30 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 3079800 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực sản xuất.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh sản xuất.

2.  H. T. Duyen (20) là 35 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 3079800 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực sản xuất.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh sản xuất.

3.  L. T. Thanh (21) là 31 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 3079800 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực sản xuất.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh sản xuất.

Về Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

Nhiệm vụ của Quỹ Hỗ trợ Phụ Nữ Nghèo Thanh Hóa (FPW) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính bền vững cho những người phụ nữ kém may mắn ở các vùng nông thôn tỉnh Thanh Hóa.

*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  ."

loans.use: To purchase raw materials to manufacture additional products

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma O. is 53 years old and married with six children, namely: Janet, age 31; Aileen, 26; Albert, 23; Leonor, 17; Dennis, 19; and Jay Arr, 13. Three of her children are still dependent on the couple and are living with them. Her eldest son is working abroad while the youngest is in secondary school.

She applied for a loan of 17,000 PHP to augment the capital needed to expand her business buying and selling meat products. With the help of her husband and children, they will buy live chickens and hogs from farms and communities raising chicken and pigs and then sell the meat products to the city market or deliver to their costumers in the neighboring locality.  They also want to buy a tricycle to use as a means of transportation for buying and delivering their products to market.

Norma believes that if her loan is granted, it will bring additional income to the family and she will be able to earn and save more for the schooling of her children. It is the popular dream of the couple to provide their children a decent life through them fulfilling an education degree, so that is why she is so dedicated and industrious.  At her age she also wanted to experience dealing with other people and doing business with them. She is happy that ASHI and KIVA are giving her this privilege.

loans.use: Buying and selling chicken and hog meat and purchasing a tricycle

loans.name: Uy

texts.en:
Mrs. Uy C., age 46, is a widowed mother of five children, two of whom are already married and live away from home, while the other three are single. Uy C. is a domestic farmer who owns farmland for growing crops. In addition, she built a place where she currently distills white wine and also uses the leftovers from distilling to feed a few pigs.

The reason that Uy C. decided to seek a Kiva loan is because she lacks money to use towards cultivating rice crops during this rainy season.

loans.use: To uses towards cultivating rice crops.

loans.name: Saroeun

texts.en:
Mr. Saroeun K. (in the photo), is 54 years old and his wife, Mrs. Sokhun Loem, is 51 years old. They have been married since 1982 and have six children: three sons and three daughters. Two of their children are married and live outside the family home, two attend school and another one stays at home. They are living in a village approximately fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

Saroeun sells firewood.  He buys trees from fellow villagers and cuts it for firewood. His wife sells vegetables in Phnom Penh market. He is applying for a loan of $1,000 as capital to help his wife to buy vegetables for resale. They will also use a part of the loan to purchase firewood for resale.

loans.use: To buy vegetables and firewood for resale.

loans.name: Bunleng

texts.en:
Mr. Bunleng R., is 36 years old and his wife, Mrs. Sayun Ket, is 36 years old, live on an island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh, have been married since 1989 and have four children-two sons and two daughters. One of them has full-time employment and other three are in school. His wife sells fish. 

Bunleng sells mangoes and tomatoes; he buys them on contract before harvesting for the future season from the fellow villagers. He has to prevent the mangoes from the insect bite by using pesticide when they are small and when the mangoes grow big enough, he takes them to sell in Phnom Penh market. He does not have enough capital to purchase mangoes on contract for resale so he is asking for a loan of $1,000 help his capital. 
Photo: is Bunleng with pesticide applicator not pumping or spraying apparatus.

loans.use: To purchase mangoes on contract

loans.name: Sophorn

texts.en:
Mrs. Sophorn K. is a villager in Mea Neak village in Takeo province and she was born in 1988. She and her husband, Mr. Bros Phorn, are farmers who own a two-hectare plot of land to cultivate rice on to sell to support their family. Moreover  Bros Phorn is also a fisherman and farm laborer. 

Mrs. Sophorn K.'s problem is that it is time to grow rice in her field, but she does not have enough rice seed. So to improve her rice production, Mrs. Sophorn K. is asking for a loan to buy rice seed to grow. With any remainder of the loan, she will rent a machine to plow her field. She is the mother of two children who are both  too young to work or study. Her husband is in the picture with her.

loans.use: To buy rice seed to grow and rent a plow

loans.name: Say

texts.en:
Mrs. Say K. is a 38-year-old widow who currently lives in the middle of Kompong Tom province, Cambodia. She works as an internal staff officer after started her job more than nine years ago. Say K. also spends time at home to do housework as well as taking care of three school-aged kids who are dependent on her income.

Due to her current income not being enough to support her family, Say K. hopes to invest in a pig raising business in order to generate more profit. As she doesn’t have capital, she decided to apply for a loan to be used to begin breeding pigs.

loans.use: To begin breeding pigs

loans.name: Fernalin

texts.en:
Fernalin M. is from the village of Corrales, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is 35 years old. Fernalin is married and has one school-aged child. To make a living, Fernalin owns & operates a service-based business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from providing mechanical services, "motor repair," to local community members. Fernalin has been engaged in her business for over one year and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Fernalin joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Fernalin has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,500 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used as additional capital for her business. Fernalin is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to repair a transport vehicle used in the business. This will be the fourth loan taken out by Fernalin from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to repair a transport vehicle used in the business

loans.name: Chhengheng

texts.en:
Mr. Chhengheng I. and his wife, Mrs. Saro Ul, live on an island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. They have been married for more than sixteen years and have three daughters. Chhengheng’s wife is shown in the photo.

Chhengheng has been a carpenter since 2005. Besides this business, he is a fisherman as well. His wife has been a silk weaver since she was sixteen years old, a skill she learned from her neighbor. She sells her finished products to a middleman in the village, who then takes them to sell in Phnom Penh.

Chhengheng is requesting a loan of US$350 to purchase a boat motor for his fishing business.

loans.use: To purchase a boat motor for his fishing business

loans.name: Chan's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Chan K., age 51, is the village bank president selected by the twelve members of this group, located in Toul Krang village in Kandal province. All members will use their portion of the loan for different purposes.

Mrs. Chan K. is a farmer who owns a 2-hectare plot of land to cultivate rice on. Her husband is a wedding musician and also helps his wife with the farm. With both of these occupations, they are able to earn a small income to support their family.   

Mrs. Chan K. is now requesting a loan to build a lavatory for family use. This couple has two children, who both are seamstresses in a garment factory.

loans.use: To build a lavatory for family use
